questions.question: Some roses are white. All lilies are white. No white flower is red. Which is certain?
choices: D) All white flowers are roses
questions.explanation: All lilies are white, and no white flowers are red. Therefore, no lily can be red.

questions.question: Q: 'R is the mother of my father.' What is R to Q?
questions.explanation: Father's mother = Grandmother.

questions.question: X is the sister of Y. Y is the brother of Z. Z is the son of P. How is P related to X?
questions.explanation: X, Y, and Z are siblings. P is their parent.

questions.question: Z, W, T, Q, N, ?
questions.explanation: $-3$ letters.

questions.question: I: 'J is the mother of my father's only son.' I is male. What is J to I?
questions.explanation: Father's only son is I himself. His mother is I's mother.

questions.question: Some fruits are green. All green things are sour. No sour thing is sweet. All sweet things are delicious. Which follows?
choices: A) Some delicious things are not green
D) All green things are fruits
questions.explanation: All green things are sour and no sour thing is sweet. Since some delicious things are sweet, those delicious things aren't sour/green.

questions.question: All kings are leaders. No leaders are followers. Some followers are soldiers. Which follows?
choices: A) No king is a soldier
B) Some soldiers are not kings
questions.explanation: Followers are not kings (because kings are leaders and leaders aren't followers). Since some soldiers are followers, those soldiers aren't kings.

questions.question: Pointing to a man in a photo, a lady said, 'His brother's father is the only son of my grandfather.' How is the lady related to the man?
questions.explanation: The man's brother's father is the man's father. 'Only son of my grandfather' is the lady's father. Therefore, they are siblings.
$n^2+n$ sequence.

questions.question: Seven people sit in a row. P is in the middle. Q is second to the left of P. R is at the right end. S is between P and R. T is to the immediate left of Q. Who is at the left end?
questions.explanation: U/V(1), T(2), Q(3), V/U(4), P(5), S(6), R(7). The person at the far left end (Position 1) is not uniquely identified.

questions.question: Only if a car has fuel will it start. The car did not start. Conclusion: The car has no fuel.
choices: D) Only if the battery is dead
questions.explanation: This is a logical fallacy (denying the consequent). P (fuel) is a necessary condition for Q (starting). If Q is false, P might still be true (e.g., the car has fuel but a dead battery).

questions.question: D4, H8, M13, S19, ?
questions.explanation: Increments of $+4, +5, +6, +7$. $19 + 7 = 26$, which is $Z$. A common mistake is using $+6$ again, resulting in $Y25$.

questions.question: All geniuses are eccentric. Some eccentric people are happy. No happy person is bored. Which follows?
choices: A) Some eccentric people are not bored
C) All happy people are eccentric
D) Some bored people are geniuses
questions.explanation: Some eccentric people are happy and no happy people are bored. Thus, those specific eccentric people aren't bored.

questions.question: All dogs are animals. No animals can talk. All talkers use language. Which follows?
choices: D) All language users are talkers
questions.explanation: Since all dogs are animals and no animals can talk, it follows directly that no dog can talk.

questions.question: V: 'W is the brother of my daughter's mother.' V is male. What is W to V?
questions.explanation: Daughter's mother = wife. Her brother = brother-in-law.

questions.question: M: 'N is the father of my brother-in-law.' M's brother-in-law is M's wife's brother. What is N to M?
questions.explanation: Wife's brother's father is the wife's father, i.e., Father-in-law.

questions.question: W: 'X is the only son of my father's sister's husband.' What is X to W?
questions.explanation: Father's sister is aunt. Her husband's son is her son, so W's cousin.

questions.question: C: 'D is the brother of my mother's brother.' What is D to C?
questions.explanation: Mother's brother = uncle. His brother is also an uncle.

questions.question: All A are B. Some B are C. No C is D. Which follows?
choices: A) Some B are not D
questions.explanation: Some B are C, and no C is D. Therefore, those B's that are C cannot be D.

questions.question: Some houses are mansions. All mansions are large. No large thing is tiny. Which is certain?
choices: B) Some houses are not tiny
C) All large things are mansions
D) Some tiny things are mansions
questions.explanation: Some houses are mansions/large. Large things aren't tiny. Thus, those specific houses aren't tiny.

questions.question: A, B, D, G, K, P, ?
Some songs are soft. No soft thing is loud. Some loud things are music. Which is certain?
choices: A) Some music is not soft
B) Some songs are not loud
questions.explanation: A is true because loud music exists and soft/loud are mutually exclusive. B is true because soft songs exist. C is given by the last premise.

questions.question: L: 'M is the father of my maternal aunt's only brother.' L's mother has only one brother. What is M to L?
questions.explanation: Maternal aunt's only brother is L's maternal uncle. His father is L's maternal grandfather.

questions.question: C, F, I, L, O, ?
questions.explanation: $+3$ letters.

questions.question: No snake has legs. All creatures with legs are fast. Some fast creatures are hunters. Which follows?
choices: A) No snake is a hunter
B) Some fast creatures are not snakes
questions.explanation: Creatures with legs are fast and creatures with legs are not snakes. Therefore, some fast creatures (the ones with legs) are not snakes.

questions.question: Seven people in a row. M is at 4. N is at 1. O is at 7. P is between M and N. Q is between M and O. R is to the left of P. Who is at 2?
A told B, 'The girl I met yesterday was the youngest daughter of the brother-in-law of my friend's mother.' How is the girl related to A's friend?
questions.explanation: Friend's mother's brother-in-law is the friend's uncle. His daughter is the friend's cousin.

questions.question: A man says to a lady, 'The brother of your mother is the father of my son's mother.' How is the lady related to the man?
questions.explanation: 'My son's mother' is the man's wife. Her father is the man's father-in-law. If the lady's mother's brother is the man's father-in-law, they are cousins.

questions.question: P: 'Q is the sister of my paternal grandfather's only son.' P's father has no sisters. Does Q exist?
choices: A) Yes, she is P's mother
B) Yes, she is P's aunt
D) Yes, she is P's sister
questions.explanation: Grandfather's only son is P's father. If the father has no sisters, Q cannot exist.

questions.question: G: 'H is the only son of my paternal grandmother.' G's father has no brothers. What is H to G?
questions.explanation: Paternal grandmother's only son = G's father.
Powers of 10.

questions.question: Pointing to a lady, Diwakar said, 'Her mother's only grandson is my son.' How is that lady related to Diwakar?
questions.explanation: Diwakar's son is the grandson of the lady's mother. This makes the lady Diwakar's wife (or sister, but wife fits the 'only grandson' context better).

questions.question: Eight people sit in a circle. A is opposite B. C is to the immediate right of A. D is second to the left of C. E is opposite D. Who is between B and E?
questions.explanation: A(1), C(2), E(5), B(4). D is second left of C (Position 8). Between B(4) and E(5) is no one, but between B and E the other way are F, G, H.

questions.question: A: 'B is the son of my sister's husband.' What is B to A?
questions.explanation: Sister's husband = brother-in-law. His son = nephew.
Squares.

questions.question: 2, B, 3, E, 5, I, 7, N, 11, ?
questions.explanation: Numbers: Prime sequence ($2, 3, 5, 7, 11$). Letters: Incremental gap ($B+3=E, E+4=I, I+5=N, N+6=T$). The trap is thinking the next number is 9 (odd) or 13, and the next letter is S ($+5$ instead of $+6$).

questions.question: O: 'P is the father of my maternal grandfather's only daughter.' What is P to O?
questions.explanation: Maternal grandfather's only daughter = O's mother. Her father = O's grandfather.

questions.question: Six people A-F sit in a row facing North. C sits second to the left of E. A sits at one of the ends. B is an immediate neighbor of both C and F. If A is at the left end, who sits to the immediate right of E?
questions.explanation: Arrangement: A(1), C(2), B(3), F(4), E(5), D(6). To the immediate right of E is D.

questions.question: Some circles are ovals. No ovals are squares. All squares have four sides. Which follows?
choices: A) Some circles are not squares
C) Some ovals have four sides
questions.explanation: Some circles are ovals. No ovals are squares. Therefore, the circles that are ovals cannot be squares.

questions.question: A is the father of C and D is the son of B. E is the brother of A. If C is the sister of D, how is B related to E?
questions.explanation: A and B are parents of C and D. E is A's brother. B is E's brother's wife (sister-in-law).

questions.question: R: 'S is my brother's only son's wife.' What is S to R?
questions.explanation: Brother's only son = nephew. His wife = niece-in-law.

questions.question: Y, W, U, S, Q, O, ?
questions.explanation: Odd letters backward.
Fibonacci sequence.

questions.question: A man says, 'My wife's only brother's only sister is my...'?
questions.explanation: The 'wife's brother's only sister' is the wife himself.

questions.question: A is the mother of B and C. D is the husband of C. E is the son of D. How is A related to E?
questions.explanation: E is the son of C. A is the mother of C. Therefore, A is E's maternal grandmother.

questions.question: Q1F, S2E, U6D, W24C, ?
questions.explanation: First letter +2: Q, S, U, W, Y. Numbers are factorials: 1!, 2!, 3!, 4!, 5! (120). Last letter decreases: F, E, D, C, B.

questions.question: E: 'F is the sister of my son's only sibling.' What is F to E?
questions.explanation: Child's sister = Daughter.

questions.question: No A is B. All C are B. All D are C. Which is cierto?
questions.explanation: D is a subset of C, C is a subset of B. Since B and A are disjoint, D and A must be disjoint.

questions.question: Pointing to a man in a photograph, a woman says, 'He is the father-in-law of the wife of the only son of my own father-in-law.' How is the man related to the woman?
questions.explanation: Father-in-law's only son is the woman's husband. Husband's wife is the woman herself. Her father-in-law is the man.

questions.question: B1C3E, D2F6J, F3I9O, H4L12T, ?
questions.explanation: First letter +2: B,D,F,H,J. Number increases: 1,2,3,4,5. Third letter: first letter+position. Fourth number: number×3. Last letter +5.

questions.question: X is the husband of Y. Z is the mother of X. W is the father of Y. V is the son of X. How is Z related to V?
questions.explanation: Z is the mother of V's father (X). Therefore, Z is V's grandmother.

questions.question: 1C, 5F, 11I, 19L, ?
questions.explanation: Number increment increases by 2: +4, +6, +8, +10 (19+10=29). Letters: +3 (C, F, I, L, O).

questions.question: Eight people sit in a circle facing the center. P is opposite S. R is third to the right of P. Q is to the immediate left of S. T is opposite Q. Who is second to the left of R?
questions.explanation: Clockwise: P, U, V, R, S, Q, T, W. (Based on P(1), S(5), R(4), Q(6), T(2)). Second left of R(4) is T(2).
Triangular numbers.

questions.question: A: 'B is the only son of my mother's only brother.' What is B to A?
questions.explanation: Mother's only brother = maternal uncle. His only son = cousin.

questions.question: Some fruits are sour. No sour things are desserts. All desserts are sweet. Which is certain?
choices: B) Some fruits are not desserts
D) Some sweet things are fruits
questions.explanation: Some fruits are sour, and no sour things are desserts. Therefore, those sour fruits are not desserts.

questions.question: A man says, 'My sister's husband's mother's only son is my...'?
questions.explanation: The 'sister's husband's mother's only son' is the sister's husband. That is the man's brother-in-law.
$n^3-1$ sequence.

questions.question: No student is a teacher. Some teachers are professors. All professors are researchers. Which follows?
choices: A) Some researchers are not students
C) No researcher is a student
questions.explanation: Professors are researchers and professors are teachers. Since no teacher is a student, no professor is a student. Thus, researchers that are professors aren't students.

questions.question: Only if a car has an engine is it heavy. This car is heavy. Conclusion: This car has an engine.
choices: C) Only if it's made of metal
D) Only if it's a truck
questions.explanation: Logically: 'Heavy (Q) $\rightarrow$ Engine (P)'. Given Q, P follows.

questions.question: 12A2, 24B4, 36C6, 48D8, ?
questions.explanation: First number +12: 12, 24, 36, 48, 60. Middle letter +1: A, B, C, D, E. Last number +2: 2, 4, 6, 8, 10.

questions.question: A, D, G, J, M, P, ?
questions.explanation: $+3$ letters.

questions.question: Seven people in a circle. A is to the left of B. C is to the right of B. D is opposite B. E is between A and D. F is between C and D. Who is opposite A?
questions.explanation: Odd numbered circle.

questions.question: O: 'P is the mother of my mother's only son.' O is female. What is P to O?
questions.explanation: Mother's only son = O's brother. His mother = O's mother.

questions.question: A man has 6 sons. Each son has exactly one sister. How many children does the man have?
questions.explanation: All 6 sons share the same sister. Total children = 6 sons + 1 sister = 7.

questions.question: If 'A $ B' means A is the brother of B; 'A # B' means A is the sister of B; 'A * B' means A is the father of B. What does 'P * Q # R $ S' mean?
choices: A) P is the father of S
B) P is the uncle of S
C) P is the grandfather of S
D) P is the son of S
questions.explanation: R $ S means R is the brother of S. Q # R means Q is the sister of R. P * Q means P is the father of Q. Thus, P is the father of all (Q, R, S).

questions.question: 2, A, 5, D, 11, J, 23, T, ?
questions.explanation: Numbers: $2n+1$. $23 	imes 2 + 1 = 47$. Letters: Position follows the number but wraps. $2=B(A?)$, wait. $A=1, D=4, J=10, T=20$. Gaps: $+3, +6, +10$. Next gap is $+14$. $20+14=34$. $34-26=8$ (H). Trap: Miscounting the alphabet wrap-around.

questions.question: A man says to a lady, 'The son of your only brother is the brother of my wife.' How is the lady related to the man?
questions.explanation: The man's wife's brother is his brother-in-law. This brother-in-law is the son of the lady's brother. This means the lady's brother is the man's father-in-law. The lady is the sister of the father-in-law.

questions.question: In a family, A is the husband of B. C is the daughter of A. D is the sister of B. How is D related to C?
questions.explanation: D is the sister of C's mother (B). Therefore, D is the maternal aunt.

questions.question: A: 'B is the daughter of my brother's father.' What is B to A?
questions.explanation: Brother's father = A's father. His daughter = A's sister.

questions.question: Seven people sit in a row. M is at the center. N is second to the left of M. O is at the right end. P is between M and O. Q is at the left end. Who is between Q and N?
questions.explanation: Q(1), R/S(2), N(3), S/R(4), M(5), P(6), O(7). Position 2 is between Q and N.

questions.question: E: 'F is the sister of my paternal grandfather's only son.' What is F to E?
questions.explanation: Paternal grandfather's only son = E's father. His sister = E's aunt.

questions.question: Pointing to a man, a woman says, 'He is the only son of the wife of my father's only son.' How is the man related to the woman?
questions.explanation: 'My father's only son' is the woman's brother. His wife's son is her nephew.

questions.question: All expensive things are luxury items. Some luxury items are imported. No imported item is tax-free. Which is certain?
choices: A) No expensive thing is tax-free
B) Some luxury items are not tax-free
C) All expensive things are imported
D) Some tax-free items are luxury
questions.explanation: Some luxury items are imported and imported items are not tax-free. Thus, some luxury items are definitely not tax-free.
$n^3-1$ sequence.

questions.question: C: 'D is the sister of my mother's husband.' What is D to C?
questions.explanation: Mother's husband = father. His sister = aunt.

questions.question: Nine people sit in a row. P is at 5. R is at 1. S is at 9. Q is between R and P. T is between P and S. If Q is at 3 and T is at 7, who is at position 2?
questions.explanation: Positions 2, 4, 6, 8 are unspecified. Any of the remaining people (U, V, W, X) could be at 2.

questions.question: All squares are rectangles. All rectangles are polygons. No polygons are circles. Which is definitely true?
questions.explanation: Since squares are polygons, and no polygons are circles, no squares are circles. Also, since all squares are polygons, there are polygons that are squares.

questions.question: X is the brother of Y. Y is the mother of Z. W is the son of Z. How is X related to W?
questions.explanation: X is the brother of W's grandmother (Y). (Wait, Y is the mother of Z, and Z is parent of W). X is the brother of W's mother's mother? No, X is brother of Y (W's grandmother). That makes him a granduncle.

questions.question: How is my father's sister's son's sister related to me?
questions.explanation: Father's sister is aunt. Her son's sister is her daughter, which is my cousin.

questions.question: A is B's brother. C is D's father. E is B's mother. A and D are brothers. How is E related to C?
questions.explanation: A, B, and D are siblings. E is their mother and C is their father. Therefore, E is the wife of C.

questions.question: B, E, H, K, N, Q, ?
J, 10, H, 8, F, 6, D, ?
questions.explanation: Descending even letters and values.

questions.question: 10A, 13C, 16E, 19G, ?
questions.explanation: Number increases by 3: 10, 13, 16, 19, 22. Letter skips one: A, C, E, G, I.

questions.question: 3, F, 6, L, 12, X, 24, ?
questions.explanation: Numbers: Doubling. Letters: Doubling position ($F=6, L=12, X=24, 48$). $48 mod{26} = 22(V)$. Wait, the choices say J. Let's look at $48-26=22$. If the pattern is $24 	imes 2 = 48$, and $48$ is the letter, it's V. If Choice A is J ($10$), that's $48-38$. Let's re-verify: $48 mod{26} = 22$. None of the choices match perfectly unless it's $X(24) + 12 = 36(J)$. Yes: $+6, +12, +12$. $24+12=36; 36-26=10(J)$.

questions.question: If A is the brother of B, B is the sister of C, and C is the father of D, how is D related to A?
questions.explanation: D is the child of A's brother (C). The gender of D is unknown, so D is either nephew or niece.

questions.question: K: 'L is the son of my father's only sister.' What is L to K?
questions.explanation: Father's sister = aunt. Her son = cousin.

questions.question: All G are H. No H are I. Some I are J. All J are K. Which is definitely FALSE?
choices: A) Some K are not H
questions.explanation: Since All G are H and No H are I, it is impossible for any G to be I. Thus, 'All G are I' is definitely false.

questions.question: M13, K11, I9, G7, ?
questions.explanation: Odd positions backward.

questions.question: If 'X + Y' means X is the husband of Y; 'X - Y' means X is the sister of Y; 'X * Y' means X is the daughter of Y. Which of the following shows P is the mother-in-law of R?
questions.explanation: S * P means S is the daughter of P. R + S means R is the husband of S. The mother of one's wife is a mother-in-law.

questions.question: A, D, G, J, M, P, ?
questions.explanation: $+3$ letters.

questions.question: Only if a tree is deciduous does it lose its leaves. This tree lost its leaves. Conclusion: This tree is deciduous.
choices: D) Only if it's not an evergreen
questions.explanation: Logically: 'Lose leaves (Q) $\rightarrow$ Deciduous (P)'. Given Q, P must follow.

questions.question: E: 'F is the mother-in-law of my brother's only sister.' What is F to E?
questions.explanation: Brother's only sister is E herself (if female) or E's sister. Her mother-in-law is E's mother-in-law.

questions.question: No musician is a banker. Some bankers are rich. All rich people are influential. Which follows?
choices: A) Some influential people are not musicians
C) Some rich people are musicians
questions.explanation: Some influential people are bankers (because some bankers are rich/influential). No banker is a musician. Thus, those influential bankers aren't musicians.

questions.question: All diamonds are hard. No hard thing is liquid. Some liquids are water. Which is true?
choices: B) Some water is not hard
questions.explanation: Hard and liquid are mutually exclusive. Since water is liquid, it's not hard. Since diamonds are hard, they aren't water/liquid.

questions.question: 3, C, 4, D, 6, F, 9, I, 13, ?
questions.explanation: Sequence: $n$, $n$-th letter. Gaps between $n$: $+1, +2, +3, +4$. Next is $13+5=18$? No, the question asks for the term after 13. The letter is $M$ (13th letter).

questions.question: Some books are novels. All novels are literature. No literature is junk. Which follows?
choices: A) Some books are not junk
questions.explanation: Some books are novels/literature. Literature isn't junk. Thus, some books aren't junk.

questions.question: Pointing to a girl, a man says, 'She is the daughter of the only sister of my father.' How is the man related to the girl?
questions.explanation: The girl is the daughter of the man's aunt. They are cousins.

questions.question: K is the brother of J. M is the sister of K. P is the brother of N. N is the daughter of J. S is the father of M. Who is the uncle of P?
questions.explanation: P and N are children of J. K is the brother of J. Therefore, K is the uncle of P.

questions.question: V's mother is the only daughter of W's father. How is W related to V?
choices: D) Both A and C are possible
questions.explanation: W's father's only daughter is either W (if W is female) or W's sister. If W is female, she is V's mother. If W is male, he is V's maternal uncle. But the statement says the *only* daughter is the mother.

questions.question: Pointing to a photograph, a woman said, 'He is the son of the only son of my father-in-law.' How is the woman related to the man?
questions.explanation: The 'only son of the father-in-law' is the woman's husband. His son is her son.

questions.question: A, Z, B, Y, C, X, D, ?
questions.explanation: Pairs of opposites ($A-Z, B-Y, C-X$). Next is $D-W$.

questions.question: B, F, J, N, R, ?
C: 'D is the only brother of my mother's only daughter.' C is female. What is D to C?
questions.explanation: Mother's only daughter = C. Her only brother = C's brother.

questions.question: K: 'L is the son of my only sister's husband.' What is L to K?
questions.explanation: Sister's husband = brother-in-law. His son is K's nephew.

questions.question: J: 'K is the mother of my brother's paternal grandfather.' What is K to J?
questions.explanation: Brother's paternal grandfather is J's paternal grandfather. His mother is J's great-grandmother.

questions.question: K: 'L is the sister of my mother's husband.' What is L to K?
questions.explanation: Mother's husband = father. His sister = paternal aunt.

questions.question: 1A1, 1B2, 2C3, 3D5, 5E8, ?
questions.explanation: Fibonacci in first and last: 1,1,2,3,5,8,13. Letters increase: A,B,C,D,E,F.

questions.question: If 'P + Q' means P is the son of Q; 'P - Q' means P is the wife of Q; 'P / Q' means P is the father of Q. What does 'A / B + C - D' mean?
choices: A) D is the grandfather of A
B) D is the husband of C
C) A is the son of D
D) C is the mother of A
questions.explanation: C - D means C is the wife of D (D is father). B + C means B is the son of C. A / B means A is the father of B. Therefore, A and C are the parents of B. A is the father, C is the mother. This means D (C's husband) is A. (Wait, re-trace: If A is father of B, and C is mother of B, then A and C are married. D is also C's husband? This makes D and A the same person).

questions.question: Some M are N. No N are O. Some O are P. Which must be true?
choices: A) Some M are not O
B) Some P are not N
questions.explanation: Some M are N, and no N is O, so those M's are not O. Some P are O, and no O is N, so those P's are not N.

questions.question: No A is B. All B are C. Some C are not D. Which follows?
choices: A) Some C are not A
C) Some D are not B
questions.explanation: All B are C, and no B is A. Therefore, the part of C that is B cannot be A. Hence, some C are not A.
Cubes.

questions.question: All cats are mammals. No mammals are birds. All birds are feathered. Which of the following is correct?
questions.explanation: Since all cats are mammals and no mammals are birds, there is no intersection between cats and birds.

questions.question: C2F, E5H, G10J, I17L, ?
questions.explanation: First letters +2: C, E, G, I, K. Numbers follow n²+1: 1²+1, 2²+1, 3²+1, 4²+1, 5²+1=26. Last letters +2: F, H, J, L, N.

questions.question: Z, 26, X, 24, V, 22, T, 20, ?
questions.explanation: Even letters backward with their positions.

questions.question: A man said, 'I have no brothers or sisters but that person's father is my father's son.' Who is the person?
questions.explanation: 'My father's son' is the man himself. The person's father is the man. Therefore, the person is his son.

questions.question: T: 'U is the wife of my mother's only brother's only son.' What is U to T?
questions.explanation: Mother's brother's son is T's cousin. His wife is T's cousin-in-law.

questions.question: D, G, J, M, P, ?
questions.explanation: $+3$ letters.

questions.question: K: 'L is the son-in-law of my father.' K is male and has no sisters. What is L to K?
questions.explanation: If K has no sisters, his father cannot have a son-in-law (unless K is female, but the prompt says male).

questions.question: How is my mother's mother's only son-in-law's only son related to me?
questions.explanation: Mother's mother's only son-in-law is my father. My father's only son is me or my brother.

questions.question: If 'A % B' means A is the wife of B; 'A & B' means A is the brother of B; 'A # B' means A is the daughter of B. Which shows P is the sister-in-law of R?
questions.explanation: Q & R means Q is the brother of R. P % Q means P is the wife of Q. The wife of one's brother is a sister-in-law.

questions.question: 5F, 7J, 11N, 13R, ?
questions.explanation: Numbers are consecutive prime numbers: 5, 7, 11, 13, 17. Letters increase by 4: F, J, N, R, V.

questions.question: Five people in a row. X is not at an end. Y is at the right end. Z is second to the left of Y. W is to the left of X. Who is at the left end?
questions.explanation: W(1), X(2), Z(3), V(4), Y(5). W is at the left end.

questions.question: A, E, I, O, U, A, ?
questions.explanation: Vowel cycle.

questions.question: M, N, P, S, W, B, ?

questions.explanation: Geometric progression $	imes 2$.

questions.question: B, 2, D, 4, F, 6, H, 8, ?
questions.explanation: Sequential even letters and numbers.

questions.question: A: 'B is the son of my father's sister.' What is B to A?
questions.explanation: Aunt's son = Cousin.

questions.question: All fruit trees have roots. Some roots are edible. No edible root is poisonous. Conclusion: No fruit tree is poisonous.
choices: C) Only if fruit trees have edible roots
D) Poisonous things have no roots
questions.explanation: Just because edible roots aren't poisonous doesn't mean the tree itself isn't poisonous. There is no link established between fruit trees and the poisonous property.

questions.question: G: 'H is my grandmother's only son's daughter.' What is H to G?
questions.explanation: Grandmother's only son = father or uncle. Since not specified as own father, must be uncle. His daughter = cousin.

questions.question: Q: 'R is the daughter of my father's only brother.' What is R to Q?
questions.explanation: Father's brother = uncle. His daughter = cousin.

questions.question: 1, G, 2, I, 6, L, 24, P, ?
questions.explanation: Numbers: Factorials ($1, 2, 6, 24, 120$). Letters: Incremental gaps ($G+2=I, I+3=L, L+4=P, P+5=U$).

questions.question: Pointing to a man, a woman said, 'He is the only son of the father of my daughter-in-law's only sister-in-law.' How is the woman related to the man?
questions.explanation: The woman's 'daughter-in-law's only sister-in-law' is her own daughter. The father of her daughter is her husband. His only son is her son. Wait—'He is the only son of the father...'—this describes her son or her husband. Given the structure, it points to her husband.

questions.question: K: 'L is the daughter of my father's only brother.' What is L to K?
questions.explanation: Uncle's daughter = Cousin.

questions.question: U: 'V is the mother of my father-in-law's only son.' U is female. What is V to U?
questions.explanation: Father-in-law's only son is U's husband. His mother is U's mother-in-law.

questions.question: If 'A $ B' means A is the brother of B, what does 'X $ Y $ Z' mean?
choices: A) X, Y, Z are brothers
questions.explanation: The symbol denotes the sibling relationship across the chain.

questions.question: Q: 'R is the only son of my father's father.' Q's father has no brothers. What is R to Q?
questions.explanation: Father's father = grandfather. Only son = Father.

questions.question: If 'A + B' means A is the brother of B; 'A - B' means A is the father of B; 'A * B' means A is the sister of B. What does 'P * Q - R + S' mean?
choices: A) P is the paternal aunt of S
B) P is the maternal aunt of S
C) P is the sister of S
D) P is the mother of S
questions.explanation: R + S means R is the brother of S. Q - R means Q is the father of R (and S). P * Q means P is the sister of Q. The sister of one's father is a paternal aunt.

questions.question: P16Q1, N14R3, L12S5, J10T7, ?
questions.explanation: First letter -2: P,N,L,J,H. Middle number -2: 16,14,12,10,8. Third letter +1: Q,R,S,T,U. Last number +2: 1,3,5,7,9.

questions.question: AZ1, BY2, CX3, DW4, ?
questions.explanation: First letter forward, second letter backward, number forward.

questions.question: C3, E5, H8, L12, ?
questions.explanation: Letters and numbers both follow an increasing gap: $+2, +3, +4, +5$. $12+5=17(Q)$.

questions.question: M, K, I, G, E, ?
questions.explanation: Odd letters backward.

questions.question: A: 'B is the only daughter-in-law of my mother.' A is male and has no brothers. What is B to A?
questions.explanation: Mother's only daughter-in-law, given A is the only son, must be A's wife.

questions.question: Some metals are liquids. All liquids are fluids. No fluids are solids. Which follows?
choices: A) Some metals are not solids
B) No metal is a solid
questions.explanation: Some metals are liquids/fluids. No fluids are solids. Thus, those specific metals aren't solids.

questions.question: Pointing to a man, a woman says, 'His father's only son's wife is my mother-in-law.' How is the woman's husband related to the man?
questions.explanation: The 'man's father's only son' is the man himself. His wife is the woman's mother-in-law. Thus, the man is the father of her husband.

questions.question: C, F, I, L, O, R, ?
I: 'J is the mother-in-law of my sister's husband.' What is J to I?
questions.explanation: Sister's husband is the brother-in-law. His mother-in-law is I's mother.

questions.question: Some songs are loud. No loud thing is soft. All soft things are pleasant. Which follows?
choices: A) Some songs are not soft
B) Some pleasant things are not songs
D) All pleasant things are soft
questions.explanation: Some songs are loud, and loud isn't soft. Thus, those songs aren't soft.

questions.question: K is the brother of N and X. Y is the mother of N. Z is the father of K. Which of the following is definitely true?
choices: A) K is the son of Y
B) Z is the husband of Y
C) N is the son of Z
questions.explanation: K, N, and X are siblings. Y is the mother and Z is the father. All children are their offspring.

questions.question: S: 'T is the daughter of my maternal grandfather's only child.' S is female. What is T to S?
questions.explanation: Grandfather's only child is S's mother. Her daughter is either S or S's sister.

questions.question: B, 25, D, 23, F, 21, H, ?
questions.explanation: Letters increase by 2, numbers decrease by 2.

questions.question: Six people sit in a row. X is at 3. Y is at 5. Z is exactly between X and Y. W is at an end. V is to the left of X. If W is at 1, who is at 6?
questions.explanation: W(1), V(2), X(3), Z(4), Y(5), U(6). U is the remaining person at 6.

questions.question: Z1A, X2C, U6F, Q24J, ?
questions.explanation: First letter decrement increases: Z-2=X, X-3=U, U-4=Q, Q-5=L. Numbers are factorials: 1!, 2!, 3!, 4!, 5!=120. Last letter increment increases: A+2=C, C+3=F, F+4=J, J+5=O.

questions.question: If X is the brother of the son of Y's son, how is X related to Y?
questions.explanation: Y's son's son is Y's grandson. The brother of a grandson is also a grandson.

questions.question: Some A are B. All B are C. No C is D. Which is certo?
choices: A) Some A are not D
C) Some C are not D
questions.explanation: A overlaps B/C, C isn't D, so A's that are in B aren't D. B is in C and C isn't D, so B isn't D. If some C are D (Wait, No C is D, so 'Some C are not D' is technically true as a subset of None).

questions.question: Some rivers are long. All long rivers are deep. No deep river is easy to cross. Which is certain?
choices: A) No river is easy to cross
B) Some rivers are not easy to cross
C) All deep rivers are long
D) Some easy-to-cross things are long rivers
questions.explanation: Some rivers are deep (the long ones). Deep rivers aren't easy to cross. Thus, some rivers aren't easy to cross.

questions.question: F6, I9, L12, O15, ?
questions.explanation: Multiples of 3 with corresponding letters.

questions.question: A is B's sister. C is B's mother. D is C's father. E is D's mother. How is B related to D?
questions.explanation: D is the father of B's mother (C). B is the grandchild of D. Since B's gender is unknown, 'grandchild' is the most accurate.
Descending squares.

questions.question: A is the mother of B. C is the son of A. D is the brother of E. E is the daughter of B. How is B related to D?
questions.explanation: D and E are children of B. Gender of B is unknown, so B is either mother or father.

questions.question: All A are B. Some B are not C. All C are D. Which follows?
choices: B) Some D are not B
questions.explanation: Standard subset logic: if All A are B, then some B must be A.

questions.question: 2B, 4D, 16P, ?
questions.explanation: Numbers are squared: 2²=4, 4²=16, 16²=256. Letters follow the same: B(2²)=4(D), D(4²)=16(P), P(16²)=256. (256 mod 26 = 22, wait... 256 mod 26 actually maps to F. 256/26 = 9 remainder 22? No, 26*9=234. 256-234=22 (V). But 26*10=260, 260-4=256, which is 4 letters before Z, so F if counting from A). Let's re-verify: 256 is exactly divisible by 2 if we use $16^2 = 256$. In series logic, letter position is the number. $256 mod{26} = 22$, which is V. Corrected answer is V if logic holds, but standard competitive exams often use simpler wraps like F.

questions.question: Pointing to a man, a girl says, 'His mother's only daughter is my mother.' How is the man related to the girl?
questions.explanation: The 'mother's only daughter' is the man's sister. She is the girl's mother. Therefore, the man is the girl's uncle.

questions.question: A1, C8, E27, G64, ?
questions.explanation: Letters +2: A, C, E, G, I. Numbers are cubes: 1³, 2³, 3³, 4³, 5³=125.

questions.question: In a family, A is the brother of B. C is the daughter of A. D is the sister of B. E is the son of C. Who is the uncle of E?
questions.explanation: E is the son of C. C is the daughter of A. The uncle of E would be C's brother. No brother of C is mentioned.

questions.question: Z, W, T, Q, N, K, ?
questions.explanation: $-3$ letters backward.

questions.question: A is the mother of B. B is the sister of C. C is the husband of D. How is A related to D?
questions.explanation: A is the mother of C. D is C's wife. Therefore, A is the mother-in-law of D.

questions.question: X: 'Y is the husband of my daughter's grandmother.' Y is not X's father. What is Y to X?
questions.explanation: Daughter's grandmother (maternal) is X's mother-in-law. Her husband is X's father-in-law.

questions.question: Some dogs are trained. All trained dogs are obedient. No obedient dog is aggressive. Which is true?
choices: A) No trained dog is aggressive
B) Some dogs are not aggressive
C) Some obedient dogs are aggressive
questions.explanation: Since all trained dogs are obedient and no obedient dog is aggressive, A is true. Since some dogs are trained/obedient, those dogs are not aggressive, making B true.

questions.question: No king is poor. All poor are struggling. Some struggling are workers. Which follows?
choices: A) Some workers are not kings
B) No king is a worker
C) Some struggling are not kings
questions.explanation: All poor are struggling and no poor are kings. Thus, the struggling people who are poor are definitely not kings.

questions.question: O: 'P is the brother of my daughter's grandmother.' P is the mother's brother. What is P to O?
questions.explanation: Mother-in-law's brother = Uncle-in-law.

questions.question: Some A are B. All B are C. Some C are D. No D is E. Which follows?
choices: A) Some B are not E
B) Some C are not E
questions.explanation: Some C are D, and no D is E. Thus, those C's that are D are not E.
$n^2-1$ sequence.

questions.question: C: 'D is the son of my father's only sister.' What is D to C?
questions.explanation: Aunt's son = Cousin.

questions.question: Z, 26, Y, 25, X, 24, W, 23, ?
questions.explanation: Descending alphabetical order paired with its position value.

questions.question: 1, C, 4, F, 7, I, 10, ?
questions.explanation: Numbers: $+3$. Letters: Position matches number + 2? No, numbers and letters are both $+3$ sequences. $10+2$ is wrong; it's $1, 4, 7, 10$ and $C(3), F(6), I(9), L(12)$.

questions.question: No triangle is a square. All squares are rectangles. Some rectangles are blue. Which follows?
choices: A) No triangle is a rectangle
B) Some rectangles are not triangles
C) All blue things are squares
questions.explanation: Squares are rectangles and squares aren't triangles. Thus, some rectangles (the squares) aren't triangles.

questions.question: A1, C4, F10, J22, ?
questions.explanation: Letters: $+2, +3, +4, +5$ (O). Numbers: $2n+2$ ($1, 4, 10, 22, 46$). Mistake: Forgetting to add 2 in the numeric doubling.

questions.question: Some diamonds are shiny. All shiny things are expensive. No expensive thing is easily found. Which follows?
choices: A) No diamonds are easily found
B) Some diamonds are not easily found
C) All shiny things are diamonds
D) Some easily found things are expensive
questions.explanation: Some diamonds are shiny/expensive. Expensive things aren't easily found. Thus, those diamonds aren't easily found.

questions.question: M, N, P, S, W, B, ?
Seven people in a circle. J is to the right of K. L is second to the left of J. M is opposite J (approx). N is between K and M. Who is second to the right of K?
questions.explanation: Clockwise: K, J, L, M, O, P, N. Second right of K is L.

questions.question: U: 'V is the father of my brother's only sister.' What is V to U?
questions.explanation: Sister's father = Father.

questions.question: B, E, H, K, N, Q, ?
D4, H8, L12, P16, ?
questions.explanation: Letters increase by 4 positions. Numbers represent the alphabetical position of the letter.

questions.question: D, H, L, P, T, X, ?
P1, R4, T9, V16, ?
questions.explanation: Letters +2: P, R, T, V, X. Numbers are squares: 1, 4, 9, 16, 25.

questions.question: All A are B. Some A are C. No B are D. Conclusion: Some C are not D.
questions.explanation: Some C are A. Since all A are B and no B are D, no A can be D. Therefore, the C's that are A cannot be D.

questions.question: M1N2O, K4L8M, I16J32K, G64H128I, ?
questions.explanation: First letter -2: M,K,I,G,E. Numbers double: 1,2; 4,8; 16,32; 64,128; 256,512.

questions.question: Y: 'Z is the only son of my paternal grandmother.' Y's father has no brothers. What is Z to Y?
questions.explanation: Paternal grandmother's only son = Y's father.

questions.question: W: 'X is the mother of my mother's only son.' W is female. What is X to W?
questions.explanation: Mother's only son = W's brother. His mother = W's mother.

questions.question: G: 'H is the mother of my father's only son.' G is male. What is H to G?
questions.explanation: Father's only son = G. His mother = G's mother.

questions.question: Eight people sit in a circle facing center. A is opposite H. B is to the immediate left of A. C is opposite B. D is third to the right of H. E is between H and C. Who is opposite D?
questions.explanation: Clockwise: A, G, D, C, H, E, F, B. Opposite D is F.

questions.question: All A are B. Some C are not B. Conclusion: Some C are not A.
choices: C) Only if some B are not A
D) Only if all C are B
questions.explanation: If All A are B, then any element not in B cannot be in A. Since some C are not in B, those C's cannot be in A.

questions.question: In a family, A is the sister-in-law of B and daughter of C. D is the only son of C and brother of E. If E is the wife of B, how is D related to B?
questions.explanation: E and D are siblings (children of C). E is B's wife. Therefore, E's brother D is B's brother-in-law.

questions.question: Only cats are feline. Lions are feline. Conclusion: Lions are cats.
questions.explanation: Logic: 'Feline (Q) $\rightarrow$ Cat (P)'. Lions are Q, so they are P.

questions.question: K is the brother of L. L is the mother of M. M is the sister of N. How is K related to N?
questions.explanation: L is the mother of both M and N. K is L's brother, so K is the maternal uncle of N.

questions.question: Some songs are loud. All loud things are annoying. No annoying thing is silent. Which follows?
choices: A) Some songs are not silent
C) Some silent things are annoying
questions.explanation: Some songs are loud/annoying. Annoying things aren't silent. Thus, some songs aren't silent.

questions.question: O: 'P is the wife of my father's only son.' O is male. What is P to O?
questions.explanation: Father's only son = O himself. His wife = P.

questions.question: No grass is blue. All blue things are cold. Some cold things are ice. Which follows?
choices: B) Some cold things are not grass
questions.explanation: Blue things are cold and blue things aren't grass. Therefore, some cold things (the blue ones) are not grass.

questions.question: Y: 'Z is the only son of my father's father.' Y's father has no brothers. What is Z to Y?
questions.explanation: Father's father = grandfather. His only son = Y's father.

questions.question: 1A1, 2D4, 3I9, 4P16, ?
questions.explanation: Pattern: $n$, $n^2$-th letter, $n^2$. $5$, $25$th letter (Y), $25$. Silly mistake: Picking Z because it's the 'end' of the alphabet.

questions.question: Some chairs are wooden. All wooden things are heavy. No heavy things are cheap. Which follows?
choices: B) Some chairs are not cheap
C) All wooden things are chairs
D) Some cheap things are wooden
questions.explanation: Some chairs are wooden/heavy. Heavy things aren't cheap. Thus, those chairs aren't cheap.

questions.question: Some birds can fly. All things that fly have wings. No winged creature is a fish. Which follows?
choices: A) Some birds are not fish
B) No bird is a fish
questions.explanation: Some birds fly (have wings). Winged creatures aren't fish. Thus, those flying birds are not fish.

questions.question: Five people sit in a circle facing outward. V is to the immediate left of W. X is second to the right of V. Y is between V and X. Who is to the right of Z?
questions.explanation: Sequence CW: W, V, Y, X, Z. Right of Z is W.

questions.question: No A is B. Some B are C. All C are D. Which follows?
choices: A) Some D are not A
questions.explanation: Some D are B (via C). Since no B is A, those D's aren't A.

questions.question: Pointing to a photograph, a person says, 'I have no brother or sister but that man's father is my father's son.' At whose photograph was the person looking?
questions.explanation: Repeat logic: Father's son is the speaker. Speaker is the father of the man in the photo.

questions.question: S: 'T is the daughter of my brother's father.' What is T to S?
questions.explanation: Father's daughter = sister.

questions.question: 1A2, 3D6, 7G14, 15J30, ?
questions.explanation: First number: $2n+1$ sequence (1, 3, 7, 15, 31). Middle letter: +3 increment (A, D, G, J, M). Last number: Double the first number (2, 6, 14, 30, 62).

questions.question: A is the uncle of B. B is the son of C. C is the daughter of D. How is A related to D?
questions.explanation: A is the uncle of D's grandson (B). A is either D's son or D's son-in-law.

questions.question: E: 'F is the father of my brother's only sister.' What is F to E?
questions.explanation: Brother's only sister = E's sister. Her father = E's father.

questions.question: 2A4, 3B9, 5C25, 7D49, ?
questions.explanation: First numbers are primes: 2,3,5,7,11. Letters increase: A,B,C,D,E. Last number is first number squared: 4,9,25,49,121.

questions.question: E is the son of A. D is the son of B. E is married to C. C is B's daughter. How is D related to E?
questions.explanation: E is married to C. D is C's brother. A wife's brother is a brother-in-law.

questions.question: Pointing to a photograph, a woman says, 'This man's son's sister is my mother-in-law.' How is the woman's husband related to the man in the photograph?
questions.explanation: The man's daughter is the woman's mother-in-law. Her son (the woman's husband) is the man's grandson.

questions.question: All books have titles. No titles are numbers. Some numbers are primes. Which follows?
choices: A) No book has a number
B) Some primes are not titles
questions.explanation: Some primes are numbers, and no numbers are titles. Therefore, those primes are not titles.

questions.question: C, 3, F, 6, I, 9, L, 12, ?
questions.explanation: Multiples of 3.

questions.question: Only if a room has windows is it bright. This room has windows. Conclusion: This room is bright.
choices: C) Only if the sun is out
D) Only if the light is on
questions.explanation: Windows (P) are necessary for brightness (Q). Having P doesn't guarantee Q (could be night).

questions.question: Some actors are singers. All singers are performers. No performer is stage-frightened. Which is true?
choices: A) Some actors are not stage-frightened
D) Some stage-frightened people are singers
questions.explanation: Some actors are singers/performers. Performers aren't stage-frightened. Thus, those actors aren't stage-frightened.

questions.question: G: 'H is the father of my maternal aunt's only son.' What is H to G?
questions.explanation: Maternal aunt's son = cousin. His father = maternal uncle.

questions.question: I: 'J is the daughter of my sister's only brother.' I is male with one sister. What is J to I?
questions.explanation: Sister's only brother = I himself. So J = I's daughter.

questions.question: Z2A, Y5D, X10G, W17J, ?
questions.explanation: Letters decrease: Z→Y→X→W→V. Numbers follow n²+1: 1²+1=2, 2²+1=5, 3²+1=10, 4²+1=17, 5²+1=26. Third letters increase by 3: A→D→G→J→M. Answer: V26M.

questions.question: If 'A + B' means A is the mother of B; 'A - B' means A is the brother of B; 'A / B' means A is the father of B. Which shows P is the grandmother of R?
questions.explanation: In A: P is mother of Q, Q is mother of R. In B: P is mother of Q, Q is father of R. Both make P a grandmother.

questions.question: Some lawyers are judges. All judges are astute. No astute person is gullible. Which follows?
choices: B) Some lawyers are not gullible
C) All astute people are judges
D) Some gullible people are judges
questions.explanation: Some lawyers are judges/astute. Astute people aren't gullible. Thus, those lawyers aren't gullible.

questions.question: Z, 1, X, 2, V, 6, T, 24, ?
questions.explanation: Alternating series. Letters: Z, X, V, T, R (-2). Numbers: 1, 2, 6, 24, 120 (Factorials).

questions.question: Y, W, U, S, Q, O, ?
questions.explanation: Odd letters backward.

questions.question: C9D, F16G, I25J, L36M, ?
questions.explanation: First letter +3: C,F,I,L,O. Number: squares (3²,4²,5²,6²,7²). Last letter: first+1: D,G,J,M,P.

questions.question: Z, X, V, T, R, P, ?
questions.explanation: Even letters backward.

questions.question: Pointing to a man, a woman said, 'He is the only son of the wife of the husband of my mother.' How is the woman related to the man?
questions.explanation: Husband of mother is father. Wife is mother. Only son is brother.

questions.question: Some clouds are gray. All gray things are gloomy. No gloomy thing is happy. Which is ciertos?
choices: A) Some clouds are not happy
C) All gloomy things are clouds
D) Some happy things are gray
questions.explanation: Some clouds are gray/gloomy. Gloomy things aren't happy. Thus, those clouds aren't happy.

questions.question: Z, Y, X, W, V, ?
questions.explanation: Simple reverse order.

questions.question: Six people in a row. X is between Y and Z. W is to the left of Y. V is at the right end. If Z is at 4, who is at 2?
questions.explanation: W(1), Y(2), X(3), Z(4), U(5), V(6). Wait, X is between Y and Z. W(1), Y(2), X(3), Z(4), U(5), V(6) works.

questions.question: All mountains are high. Some high things are dangerous. No mountain is dangerous. Which follows?
choices: A) Some high things are not mountains
B) No high thing is a mountain
C) Some dangerous things are mountains
D) All high things are mountains
questions.explanation: If some high things are dangerous and no mountain is dangerous, then those dangerous high things cannot be mountains.

questions.question: All poets are creative. No creative person is boring. Some boring people are funny. Which is correct?
choices: A) Some funny people are not creative
C) All funny people are poets
D) Some creative people are funny
questions.explanation: Some funny people are boring. No creative person is boring. Therefore, the funny people who are boring are not creative.

questions.question: K1, M3, P6, T10, ?
questions.explanation: Letters increase by +2, +3, +4, +5: K, M, P, T, Y. Numbers follow the triangular number sequence (or +2, +3, +4, +5): 1, 3, 6, 10, 15.

questions.question: Introducing a man, a woman said, 'His wife is the only daughter of my father.' How is that man related to the woman?
questions.explanation: Father's only daughter is the woman herself. She is the man's wife.

questions.question: All athletes are disciplined. All disciplined people are successful. No successful person is a failure. Conclusion: No failure is an athlete.
choices: C) Only if some athletes are failures
D) Some disciplined people are failures
questions.explanation: Athletes are successful. Successful people are not failures. Therefore, no athlete can be a failure.

questions.question: I: 'J is the mother of my mother's husband.' What is J to I?
questions.explanation: Father's mother = Grandmother.

questions.question: 1B, 4D, 9F, 16H, 25J, ?
questions.explanation: Numbers are perfect squares: 1²,2²,3²,4²,5²,6²=36. Letters skip one (even positions): B,D,F,H,J,L.
$n^2+n$ sequence.
Powers of 10.

questions.question: All poets are dreamers. Some dreamers are lazy. No lazy person is productive. Which follows?
choices: A) Some dreamers are not productive
D) All productive people are dreamers
questions.explanation: Some dreamers are lazy and lazy people aren't productive. Thus, some dreamers are not productive.

questions.question: Some students are brilliant. All brilliant students are scholarships-holders. No scholarship-holder is poor. Which follows?
choices: A) Some students are not poor
D) Some poor people are students
questions.explanation: Some students are brilliant/scholarship-holders. Since those aren't poor, those students aren't poor.

questions.question: M is the son of P. Q is the granddaughter of O, who is the husband of P. How is M related to O?
questions.explanation: O is P's husband. M is P's son. Therefore, M is also O's son.

questions.question: All squares are quadrilaterals. No quadrilaterals are triangles. Some triangles are equilateral. Conclusion: No equilateral is a square.
choices: C) Only if all triangles are equilateral
questions.explanation: Squares are quadrilaterals. Quadrilaterals and triangles are mutually exclusive. Since equilaterals (in this context) are triangles, they cannot be squares.

questions.question: A man said to a woman, 'Your brother's only sister is my mother.' How is the woman related to the man's father?
questions.explanation: The woman's 'brother's only sister' is the woman herself. She is the man's mother, so she is the wife of the man's father.

questions.question: A man said to a woman, 'Your mother's husband's sister is my aunt.' How are the man and woman related?
questions.explanation: Woman's mother's husband is her father. Her father's sister is her aunt. If that same person is the man's aunt, they are cousins (or siblings, but 'Cousins' is the logical choice here).

questions.question: All A are B. All C are B. Which follows?
questions.explanation: If All A are B, then by default, some B (the part that is A) must be A.

questions.question: In a family, A is the brother of B. C is the father of A. D is the mother of B. E is the son of D. How is E related to A?
questions.explanation: A, B, and E are all children of the same parents (C and D). Therefore, E is A's brother.

questions.question: Z1, Y2, X6, W24, ?
questions.explanation: Letters: Reverse alphabetical. Numbers: Factorials ($1!, 2!, 3!, 4!, 5! = 120$). Mistake: Picking U because you subtract two letters instead of one.
Squares.

questions.question: Some M are N. All N are O. Some O are P. No P is Q. Which is correct?
choices: A) Some M are not Q
B) Some O are not Q
questions.explanation: Some O are P. No P is Q. Therefore, the part of O that is P cannot be Q.

questions.question: No A is B. No B is C. Some C is D. Conclusion: Some D is not B.
questions.explanation: Some C is D. Since No B is C, any D that is a C cannot be a B. Thus, some D is not B.

questions.question: S: 'T is the sister of my daughter's father.' What is T to S?
questions.explanation: Daughter's father = S's husband. His sister = sister-in-law.

questions.question: A1, C4, E9, G16, ?
questions.explanation: Letters: +2. Numbers: Squares of sequential integers.

questions.question: C: 'D is the wife of my son's father.' What is D to C?
questions.explanation: Son's father = C (if C is male) or C's husband. If C is male, D is his wife.

questions.question: 100W, 81U, 64S, 49Q, ?
questions.explanation: Numbers are descending squares: $10^2, 9^2, 8^2, 7^2, 6^2=36$. Letters decrease by 2: W, U, S, Q, O.

questions.question: 1, A, 2, D, 6, I, 24, P, ?
questions.explanation: Numbers: Factorials. Letters: $n^2$ position.

questions.question: W: 'X is the only son of my father's only daughter's husband.' What is X to W?
questions.explanation: Father's only daughter is W's sister. Her husband's son is W's nephew.

questions.question: Seven people sit in a circle facing the center. A is third to the left of B. C is second to the right of A. D is between B and C. E is to the immediate left of A. Who is second to the right of B?
questions.explanation: Clockwise: B, G, F, C, D, A, E. Second right (CCW) of B is E.

questions.question: Some people are honest. No honest person is a thief. Some thieves are clever. Which follows?
choices: A) Some clever people are not honest
B) No clever person is honest
C) Some honest people are clever
questions.explanation: Some clever people are thieves. No thieves are honest. Therefore, those clever thieves are not honest.

questions.question: No A are B. All C are A. Some D are not C. Which follows?
choices: B) Some D are not A
questions.explanation: Since all C are A and no A are B, it is impossible for any C to be B.

questions.question: Z, X, V, T, R, ?
questions.explanation: Reverse even letters.

questions.question: S: 'T is the only child of my father's only brother.' What is T to S?
questions.explanation: Father's only brother = paternal uncle. His only child = cousin.

questions.question: A, E, I, O, U, A, ?
questions.explanation: Vowel cycle.

questions.question: Some cars are red. No red thing is a boat. All boats float. Which follows?
choices: A) Some cars are not boats
B) No car is a boat
C) All things that float are boats
questions.explanation: Some cars are red and no red thing is a boat. Thus, those red cars aren't boats.

questions.question: G: 'H is the daughter of my father's only brother.' What is H to G?
questions.explanation: Uncle's daughter = Cousin.

questions.question: No P are Q. All Q are R. Some R are S. Which follows?
choices: B) Some R are not P
questions.explanation: All Q are R, and no Q are P. Therefore, the part of R that is Q can never be P. So, some R are not P.

questions.question: No philosopher is a fool. Some fools are poets. All poets are dreamers. Which of the following must be true?
choices: A) Some dreamers are not philosophers
B) Some poets are not philosophers
C) No philosopher is a dreamer
questions.explanation: Some poets/dreamers are fools. Since no fool is a philosopher, those specific poets and dreamers cannot be philosophers.

questions.question: M: 'N is the sister of my son's only sibling.' What is N to M?
questions.explanation: Son's only sibling = M's other child. That child's sister = M's daughter.

questions.question: Six people in a circle facing outward. J is opposite K. L is to the immediate right of J. M is opposite L. N is between K and M. Who is to the immediate left of J?
questions.explanation: Sequence CW: J, L, N, K, O, M. Left of J (CCW) is M. Wait, checking clockwise logic for outward-facing: CCW is left. M is left of J.

questions.question: I: 'J is the son of my father's father-in-law.' What is J to I?
questions.explanation: Father's father-in-law is I's maternal grandfather. His son is I's maternal uncle.

questions.question: Six people sit in a row. M is at position 3. N is at position 6. O is between M and N. P is to the immediate left of M. Q is at the left end. Who is at position 5?
questions.explanation: Q(1), P(2), M(3), O(4), R(5), N(6). Since O is between M and N, and 4/5 are available, O and R fill those slots.

questions.question: Six people sit in a circle facing center. A is to the right of B. C is to the right of A. D is opposite A. E is to the right of D. Who is to the right of F?
questions.explanation: Clockwise: A, C, E, D, F, B. Right of F is B.

questions.question: All athletes are fit. Some fit people are vegetarians. No vegetarian eats meat. Which follows?
choices: B) Some fit people do not eat meat
D) All fit people are athletes
questions.explanation: Some fit people are vegetarians and vegetarians don't eat meat. Thus, those fit people don't eat meat.

questions.question: S: 'T is the father of my mother's sister.' What is T to S?
questions.explanation: Mother's sister's father = maternal grandfather.

questions.question: A26Z, C24X, E22V, G20T, ?
questions.explanation: First letter +2: A, C, E, G, I. Number is the reverse position value (27 - forward position): 26, 24, 22, 20, 18. Last letter is the reverse equivalent: Z, X, V, T, R.

questions.question: 3, C, 24, X, 5, E, 22, V, 7, G, ?
questions.explanation: Pairs of 'Letter and Opposite' (Sum to 27). $3+24=27$ ($C/X$), $5+22=27$ ($E/V$), $7+20=27$ ($G/T$). Mistake: Calculating the sum as 26 or 28.

questions.question: Only mammals have hair. This creature has hair. Conclusion: This creature is a mammal.
choices: C) Only if it's not a bird
D) Depends on the hair color
questions.explanation: 'Only mammals have hair' is 'If it has hair, it is a mammal'. This is a valid deduction.

questions.question: Ten people sit in two rows (5 each). Row 1 (A-E) faces Row 2 (P-T). A is opposite T. B is to the immediate left of A. S is opposite B. C is in the middle of Row 1. Who is opposite C?
questions.explanation: Row 1: E, D, C, B, A. Row 2: P, Q, R, S, T. Mapping: C is opposite R.

questions.question: W: 'X is the mother of my father's only son.' W is male. What is X to W?
questions.explanation: W's mother.

questions.question: A, F, K, P, U, ?
questions.explanation: $+5$ letters.

questions.question: If 'A + B' means A is the sister of B, and 'A * B' means A is the daughter of B, what does 'X * Y + Z' mean?
questions.explanation: Y is the sister of Z. X is the daughter of Y. A sister's daughter is a niece.

questions.question: Some pens are blue. No blue items are red. All red items are bright. Which must be true?
choices: A) Some bright items are not blue
B) Some bright items are not pens
questions.explanation: Red items are bright and red items aren't blue. Thus, the bright items that are red are not blue.

questions.question: K: 'L is the only sister of my father's father.' What is L to K?
questions.explanation: Father's father = grandfather. His sister = grand-aunt.

questions.question: A, C, F, J, O, U, ?
C: 'D is the son of my mother's only son's wife.' C has one brother. What is D to C?
questions.explanation: Mother's only son = C's brother. His wife’s son = brother's son → nephew to C. Wait, re-evaluate. Mother's only son must be C's brother (since C has one brother). So D = brother's son → nephew. Correct answer A.

questions.question: All A are B. Some B are C. No C are D. Which follows?
choices: A) Some B are not D
questions.explanation: Some B are C, and no C are D. Therefore, the B's that are C cannot be D.

questions.question: All pilots are trained. No trained people are reckless. Some reckless people are brave. Which follows?
choices: B) Some brave people are not pilots
C) Some trained people are brave
questions.explanation: No pilot is reckless. Some brave people are reckless. Therefore, those brave-reckless people cannot be pilots.

questions.question: Five people in a circle. A is adjacent to B and C. D is second to the left of B. Where is E?
questions.explanation: Clockwise: A, B, E, D, C. E is between B and D.

questions.question: C: 'D is the sister of my wife's only brother.' What is D to C?
questions.explanation: Wife's only brother's sister is the wife herself.

questions.question: Eight people sit in a circle facing the center. M is opposite N. O is second to the right of M. P is opposite O. Q is between M and P. R is to the immediate left of N. Who is opposite R?
questions.explanation: Clockwise: M, Q, P, T, N, R, O, S. Q is at position 2 and R is at position 6; in an 8-person circle, they are opposite.
Powers of 2.

questions.question: Some A are B. No B is C. All C are D. Which must be false?
choices: D) Some D are not B
questions.explanation: All C are B is false because no B is C (mutually exclusive).

questions.question: S: 'T is the daughter of my wife.' What is T to S?
questions.explanation: Wife's daughter = S's daughter.

questions.question: W: 'X is the brother of my son's paternal grandmother.' What is X to W?
questions.explanation: Son's paternal grandmother is W's mother. Her brother is W's uncle.

questions.question: J10, L12, N14, P16, ?
questions.explanation: Even position letters and their values.

questions.question: B, D, H, N, ?
C, F, J, O, U, ?
