B) R is the mother of P
C) R is the sister of P
D) Q is the brother of P
questions.explanation: Q * R means Q is the husband of R. P % Q means P is the son of Q. Therefore, R is the mother of P.

questions.question: Eight people in a circle. A is opposite B. C is opposite D. E is second to the right of A. F is second to the right of B. Who is between C and E?
questions.explanation: Clockwise: A, G, E, C, B, H, F, D. Between C and E is A (Wait, A is 1, E is 3, C is 4). A is not between them.

questions.question: G: 'H is the only grandson of my mother-in-law.' G has only one child, a son. What is H to G?
questions.explanation: Mother-in-law's grandson is G's son (or nephew, but given G has a son, it's G's son).

questions.question: All kings are mortal. No gods are mortal. Some gods are powerful. Which follows?
choices: A) Some powerful things are not kings
C) All powerful things are gods
questions.explanation: Gods are not kings (because gods are immortal). Since some powerful things are gods, those powerful things are not kings.

questions.question: Six people (A, B, C, D, E, F) sit in a row. C is to the immediate right of E. A is between D and E. B is to the immediate left of D. F is at the right end. Who is at the left end?
questions.explanation: Arrangement: B(1), D(2), A(3), E(4), C(5), F(6). B is at the left end.

questions.question: A family of 5: P, Q, R, S, T. P and Q are a couple. R is the daughter of P. S is the son of Q. T is the brother of P. How is T related to S?
questions.explanation: S is the child of P and Q. T is the brother of P. Therefore, T is S's uncle.

questions.question: All winter days are short. No short days are energetic. Some energetic days are productive. Conclusion: Some productive days are not winter days.
choices: C) Only if all winter days are productive
D) All winter days are energetic
questions.explanation: Winter days are short. No short days are energetic. Thus, winter days aren't energetic. Since some productive days are energetic, those specific productive days cannot be winter days.

questions.question: Looking at a portrait, a man said, 'I have no brother or sister, but that man's father is my father's son.' Whose portrait was it?
questions.explanation: My father's son = Me (since he has no siblings). So, 'That man's father is Me.' The portrait is of his son.

questions.question: I: 'J is the grandmother of my brother's daughter.' J is the mother of I's father. What is J to I?
questions.explanation: Brother's daughter = niece. Her grandmother (father's side) = I's grandmother.

questions.question: A, Z, B, Y, C, X, D, W, ?
questions.explanation: Alternating forward and backward alphabetical order.

questions.question: No P are Q. Some Q are R. All R are S. Which follows?
choices: A) Some S are not P
questions.explanation: Some S are Q (via R). No Q is P. Therefore, those S's are not P.

questions.question: M: 'N is the brother-in-law of my only sister.' M is male. What is N to M?
questions.explanation: Sister's husband = brother-in-law.

questions.question: C: 'D is the son of my father's only daughter.' C has one sister. What is D to C?
questions.explanation: Father's only daughter must be C (since C has only one sister). So D is C's son.

questions.question: All fruit is sweet. No sweet thing is bitter. Some bitter things are vegetables. Which follows?
choices: B) Some vegetables are not fruit
questions.explanation: Fruit is sweet/not bitter (A). Vegetables overlap bitter, and bitter is not fruit, so some vegetables aren't fruit (B).

questions.question: K: 'L is the mother of my wife's only son.' K is male. What is L to K?
questions.explanation: Wife's only son = K's son. His mother = K's wife.

questions.question: A2, D5, I10, P17, ?
questions.explanation: Letters are $n^2$ positions ($1, 4, 9, 16, 25=Y$). Numbers are $n^2+1$ ($2, 5, 10, 17, 26$).

questions.question: K: 'L is the son of my paternal uncle.' What is L to K?
questions.explanation: Paternal uncle's son = cousin.

questions.question: Ten people in a row. A is at 2. J is at 9. B is at 4. I is at 7. C is exactly between A and B. H is exactly between I and J. Who is at position 8?
Pointing to a man, a woman said, 'He is the son of the only son of the father of my husband.' How is the woman related to the man?
questions.explanation: 'Father of my husband' is the father-in-law. His 'only son' is her husband. His son is her son.

questions.question: If 'A ! B' means A is the daughter of B; 'A ? B' means A is the son of B; 'A * B' means A is the spouse of B. What does 'P * Q ? R ! S' mean?
choices: A) P is the son-in-law of R
B) P is the daughter-in-law of R
C) P is the grandson of S
D) P is the son of S
questions.explanation: R ! S means R is the daughter of S. Q ? R means Q is the son of R. P * Q means P is the spouse of Q. If Q is the son, P is the daughter-in-law (assuming standard binary). (Wait, P * Q means spouse. If Q is male, P is female son-in-law/daughter-in-law. Choice A says son-in-law, Choice B says daughter-in-law. If Q is son, his spouse P is daughter-in-law).

questions.question: All A are B. Some B are not C. Which follows?
choices: A) Some A are not C
questions.explanation: If All A are B, then by definition, the B's that are A exist, so some B are A.

questions.question: E: 'F is the mother of my sister's mother.' What is F to E?
questions.explanation: Sister's mother = E's mother. Her mother = E's grandmother.

questions.question: Only poets are dreamers. Some dreamers are painters. All painters are artists. Which follows?
choices: D) No artist is a poet
questions.explanation: 'Only poets are dreamers' means all dreamers are poets. Since some dreamers are painters/artists, some poets must be artists.

questions.question: All poets are dreamers. Some dreamers are painters. No painters are sculptures. Which follows?
choices: A) No poet is a painter
B) Some dreamers are not sculptures
D) No poet is a sculpture
questions.explanation: Some dreamers are painters, and no painters are sculptures. Thus, those dreamers who are painters cannot be sculptures.

questions.question: All roads are concrete. No concrete is soft. All feathers are soft. Which is true?
choices: B) No road is a feather
D) All soft things are feathers
questions.explanation: Roads are concrete. Concrete is not soft. Feathers are soft. Therefore, roads and feathers have no overlap.

questions.question: 2, B, 3, C, 5, E, 7, G, 11, ?
questions.explanation: Prime numbers and their corresponding letters. $11$ is $K$.
Factorials.

questions.question: 2B, 3D, 5H, 7P, ?
questions.explanation: Numbers are primes: 2, 3, 5, 7, 11. Letter position doubles: B(2), D(4), H(8), P(16), 32. Since 32nd letter: 32 - 26 = 6 (F).

questions.question: All winter days are cold. Some short days are winter days. No cold day is humid. Which follows?
choices: A) Some short days are not humid
B) No short day is humid
C) All cold days are winter days
D) Some humid days are winter days
questions.explanation: Some short days are winter days (and thus cold). No cold day is humid. Thus, those specific short days aren't humid.

questions.question: If 'P @ Q' means P is the mother of Q; 'P $ Q' means P is the husband of Q; 'P # Q' means P is the sister of Q. Which of the following shows that X is the aunt of Z?
questions.explanation: Y @ Z means Y is the mother of Z. X # Y means X is the sister of Y. The sister of one's mother is an aunt.

questions.question: No window is a door. All doors have handles. Some handles are gold. Which follows?
choices: A) No window has a handle
B) Some things with handles are not windows
C) All handles are on doors
D) Some gold things are windows
questions.explanation: Doors have handles and doors aren't windows. Thus, the handles on doors are not on windows.

questions.question: E: 'F is the father of my brother's only sibling.' E is female. What is F to E?
questions.explanation: E's father.

questions.question: No A is B. All B are C. Some D are A. Conclusion: Some D are not B.
questions.explanation: Some D are A. No A is B. Thus, the D's that are A cannot be B.

questions.question: Some scientists are writers. All writers are readers. No readers are illiterate. Which follows?
choices: A) Some scientists are not illiterate
questions.explanation: Scientists/writers/readers are not illiterate, and writers are readers/not illiterate.

questions.question: A's son B is married to C whose sister D is married to E the brother of B. How is D related to A?
questions.explanation: D is the wife of A's son E. Thus, D is A's daughter-in-law.

questions.question: A1Z, D4W, H8S, M13N, ?
questions.explanation: First letter increment: +3, +4, +5, +6: A, D, H, M, S. Number matches first letter position. Last letter is the opposite of the first (Sum=27): Z, W, S, N, H.

questions.question: Q is the son of P. X is the daughter of Q. R is the mother of X. How is R related to P?
questions.explanation: X is the daughter of Q and R. So Q and R are a couple. Since Q is the son of P, R is the daughter-in-law of P.
Multipliers increase: $	imes 2, 	imes 3, 	imes 4, 	imes 5, 	imes 6$.

questions.question: 5, G, 10, J, 20, M, 40, P, ?
questions.explanation: Alternating sequence: Numbers double (×2), Letters +3 (G, J, M, P, S).
Multiply previous two numbers to get the next.

questions.question: O: 'P is the brother-in-law of my only sister.' O is male and has no brothers. What is P to O?
questions.explanation: Sister's brother-in-law could be her husband's brother or O himself (if O were her husband's brother), but typically in these puzzles, it refers to the sister's husband.

questions.question: M: 'N is the sister of my mother's only daughter.' What is N to M?
questions.explanation: Mother's only daughter = M. Her sister = M's sister.

questions.question: All winter days are cold. Some cold days are snowy. No snowy day is warm. Which follows?
choices: A) Some winter days are snowy
B) Some cold days are not warm
C) No winter day is warm
D) All snowy days are cold
questions.explanation: Some cold days are snowy and no snowy days are warm. Thus, those cold snowy days are not warm.

questions.question: A, D, I, P, Y, ?
A and B are a married couple. X and Y are brothers. X is the brother of A. How is Y related to B?
questions.explanation: X and Y are brothers of A. A's husband/wife's brother is a brother-in-law to B.

questions.question: Q: 'R is the daughter of my mother's only brother's wife.' What is R to Q?
questions.explanation: Mother's brother is uncle. His wife's daughter is the uncle's daughter, which is a cousin.

questions.question: A1Z26, C3X24, E5V22, G7T20, ?
questions.explanation: First letter +2: A,C,E,G,I. Middle number is position value: A=1,C=3,E=5,G=7,I=9. Last letter -2: Z,X,V,T,R with position values 26,24,22,20,18.

questions.question: A1, D2, I3, P4, ?
questions.explanation: Letters are position $n^2$: $1^2(A), 2^2(D), 3^2(I), 4^2(P), 5^2(Y)$. Numbers are simple sequence. Trap: Picking Z because it's the 'last' letter.

questions.question: A: 'B is the grandmother of my brother's daughter.' B is the mother of A's father. What is B to A?
questions.explanation: Father's mother = Grandmother.

questions.question: Some flowers are roses. All roses have thorns. No thorns are soft. Which follows?
choices: B) Some flowers are not soft
D) Some soft things are roses
questions.explanation: Some flowers are roses (and have thorns). Thorns aren't soft. Thus, those specific flowers aren't soft.

questions.question: K: 'L is the wife of my mother's only brother.' What is L to K?
questions.explanation: Mother's brother is uncle. His wife is aunt.

questions.question: If 'P % Q' means P is the father of Q; 'P & Q' means P is the wife of Q; 'P * Q' means P is the daughter of Q. What does 'A & B % C * D' mean?
choices: A) D is the mother of C
B) D is the wife of B
C) A is the mother of D
D) A is the daughter of D
questions.explanation: B % C means B is the father of C. C * D means C is the daughter of D. Thus B and D are the parents. Since B is the father, D is the mother/wife.

questions.question: C: 'D is the brother of my son's maternal grandmother.' What is D to C?
questions.explanation: Son's maternal grandmother is C's mother-in-law. Her brother is C's uncle-in-law.

questions.question: In a family, B is the brother of C. D is the son of B. E is the daughter of C. F is the mother of B. How is F related to E?
questions.explanation: F is the mother of C. E is the daughter of C. Therefore, F is the maternal grandmother of E.

questions.question: Some G are H. All H are I. Some I are J. No G is J. Which follows?
choices: A) Some I are not G
B) Some J are not I
questions.explanation: Some I are H (and thus G). Since no G is J, those specific I's are not J. Conversely, the part of I that is G exists, and we know no G is J, but more simply: Some I are H, and all H are G is not true. However, some G are H (which are I). Since No G is J, those I's aren't J. Also, some I are G (via H). Since No G is J, those I's aren't J.

questions.question: B2C, D4E, F6G, H8I, ?
questions.explanation: Sequential even letters and numbers. $J=10$.

questions.question: F: 'G is the only brother of my maternal grandmother's only daughter.' F's mother has no sisters. What is G to F?
questions.explanation: Grandmother's only daughter is F's mother. Her brother is F's maternal uncle.

questions.question: 4D, 9I, 16P, 25Y, ?
questions.explanation: Numbers: Squares. Letters: Position matches the number. $36 mod{26} = 10(J)$.

questions.question: 1Z, 2Y, 4X, 8W, ?
questions.explanation: Numbers: Double (×2). Letters: Reverse alphabetical order.

questions.question: X and Y are the children of Z. Z is the father of X but Y is not the son of Z. What is Y to Z?
questions.explanation: If Y is a child but not a son, Y must be a daughter.

questions.question: B2, D4, H8, P16, ?
questions.explanation: Numbers ×2: 2, 4, 8, 16, 32. Letter position matches the number: B(2), D(4), H(8), P(16), F(32nd letter or 6th in circular: 32-26=6=F).

questions.question: E: 'F is the mother of my sister-in-law.' E's sister-in-law is his brother's wife. What is F to E?
questions.explanation: The mother of a brother's wife is not typically a direct relation in standard kinship, though often called 'in-law' socially.

questions.question: All A are B. Some B are C. All C are D. Conclusion: Some D are B.
questions.explanation: Some B are C and all C are D. Therefore, some B are D, which also means some D are B.

questions.question: Q: 'R is the brother of my mother's only daughter-in-law.' Q is female and has one brother. What is R to Q?
questions.explanation: Mother's daughter-in-law is the brother's wife. Her brother is Q's brother-in-law.

questions.question: A woman says to a man, 'The only daughter of your father is the sister of my mother.' How is the man related to the woman?
questions.explanation: 'Only daughter of your father' is the man's sister. She is the woman's mother. Therefore, the man is the woman's maternal uncle.

questions.question: Seven people in a circle. A is to the immediate right of B. C is second to the left of A. D is opposite A. E is between C and D. Who is second to the right of B?
questions.explanation: Clockwise: B, A, F, D, E, C, G. Second right of B is F.

questions.question: R is the son of S. T is the daughter of R. U is the brother of T. What is S to U?
questions.explanation: R is U's father. S is R's parent. S is the grandparent (Grandfather or Grandmother).

questions.question: Eight people in a circle. A is opposite E. B is opposite F. C is opposite G. D is opposite H. If C is between B and E, who is between A and G?
questions.explanation: Sequence: A, B, C, E, G, F, D, H. Wait, sequence must keep pairs opposite. A-E, B-F, C-G, D-H. If A, B, C, D are 1, 2, 3, 4, then E, F, G, H are 5, 6, 7, 8. Between A(1) and G(7) is H(8).

questions.question: Pointing to a man, a woman said, 'His mother is the only daughter-in-law of my mother's only daughter-in-law.' How is the woman related to the man?
questions.explanation: The woman's 'mother's only daughter-in-law' is the woman's brother's wife. Her 'only daughter-in-law' is her son's wife. If that son's wife is the man's mother, the woman is the man's grandmother.

questions.question: B, 4, F, 36, J, 100, N, ?
questions.explanation: Letters: $+4$ ($B=2, F=6, J=10, N=14$). Numbers: The letter's position value squared ($2^2=4, 6^2=36, 10^2=100$). Next is $14^2 = 196$. Mistake: Squaring 13 ($169$) or 12 ($144$).

questions.question: Y: 'Z is the father of my sister's son.' What is Z to Y?
questions.explanation: Sister's husband = brother-in-law.

questions.question: E: 'F is the daughter of my sister's only brother.' E has no brothers. What is F to E?
questions.explanation: Sister's only brother = E (since E has no brothers). So F is E's daughter.

questions.question: If 'A + B' means A is the husband of B, 'A / B' means A is the sister of B, what does 'X / Y + Z' mean?
questions.explanation: Y is the husband of Z. X is the sister of Y. A husband's sister is a sister-in-law.

questions.question: A, 2, D, 5, G, 8, J, ?
questions.explanation: Alternating sequence of $+3$ for both letters and numbers.

questions.question: J10, L12, O15, S19, ?
questions.explanation: Increments of +2, +3, +4, +5 for both letters and numbers.

questions.question: Eight people sit in two rows. Row 1: A, B, C, D. Row 2: P, Q, R, S. A is opposite P. B is between A and C. S is at the left end of Row 2. Q is opposite B. Who is opposite D?
questions.explanation: Row 1: A, B, C, D. Row 2: P, Q, R, S. A-P, B-Q, C-R, D-S. Wait, S is at the left end. If Row 2 is S, R, Q, P, then D is opposite S.

questions.question: K: 'L is the son of my father's sister.' What is L to K?
questions.explanation: Father's sister = aunt. Her son = cousin.

questions.question: A1B, E5F, I9J, M13N, ?
questions.explanation: First letter +4: A, E, I, M, Q. Number is the position value of the first letter: 1, 5, 9, 13, 17. Last letter is first letter + 1: B, F, J, N, R.

questions.question: Q: 'R is the son of my maternal aunt.' What is R to Q?
questions.explanation: Maternal aunt's son = cousin.

questions.question: All geniuses are eccentric. No eccentric person is normal. Some normal people are happy. Which follows?
choices: B) Some happy people are not geniuses
C) Some eccentric people are happy
D) All happy people are geniuses
questions.explanation: No genius is normal. Some happy people are normal. Therefore, those happy-normal people cannot be geniuses.

questions.question: Seven people in a circle. J is second to the right of K. L is opposite K (approx). M is to the immediate left of J. N is between K and L. Who is third to the left of K?
questions.explanation: Clockwise: K, P, J, M, L, O, N. Third left of K is M.

questions.question: Z26, X24, U21, Q17, ?
questions.explanation: Letter position and number are the same. Gaps: $-2, -3, -4, -5$. $17-5=12(L)$.

questions.question: A: 'B is the son of my maternal uncle's only sister.' A has no siblings. What is B to A?
questions.explanation: Maternal uncle's only sister is A's mother. Her son (since A has no siblings) is A himself.

questions.question: All window-shoppers are curious. No curious people are indifferent. Some indifferent people are wealthy. Which follows?
choices: B) Some wealthy people are not window-shoppers
C) All curious people are window-shoppers
questions.explanation: Window-shoppers are curious. No curious people are indifferent. Thus, window-shoppers aren't indifferent. Since some wealthy people are indifferent, they cannot be window-shoppers.

questions.question: Pointing to a man, a woman says, 'His father is the only son of my grandfather.' How is the woman related to the man?
questions.explanation: Grandfather's only son is the woman's father. If he is also the man's father, they are siblings.

questions.question: U: 'V is the sister of my wife's father-in-law.' What is V to U?
questions.explanation: Wife's father-in-law is U's father. His sister is U's aunt.

questions.question: Some M are N. Some N are P. All P are Q. No Q are R. Which follows?
choices: B) Some N are not R
questions.explanation: Some N are P and all P are Q, so some N are Q. Since those N's are Q's and no Q is R, those N's are not R. All P are Q and no Q is R, so no P is R.

questions.question: If 'P / Q' means P is the father of Q; 'P * Q' means P is the sister of Q; 'P + Q' means P is the daughter of Q. What does 'A + B / C * D' mean?
choices: A) A is the sister of D
B) A is the aunt of D
C) A is the niece of D
D) A is the cousin of D
questions.explanation: B / C means B is the father of C. C * D means C is the sister of D (B is father of D). A + B means A is the daughter of B. Therefore, A, C, and D are siblings. (Wait, let's re-read: choice D says cousin... trace again: A, C, D are children of B. So A is sister of D).

questions.question: Q: 'R is the son of my sister's husband.' What is R to Q?
questions.explanation: Sister's son = Nephew.

questions.question: Pointing to a man, a woman says, 'His mother's only daughter-in-law is my mother.' How is the woman related to the man?
questions.explanation: The man's 'mother's only daughter-in-law' is his wife. If she is the woman's mother, the man is the woman's father.

questions.question: E: 'F is the husband of my father's sister.' What is F to E?
questions.explanation: Father's sister = aunt. Her husband = uncle.

questions.question: 2M, 6K, 18I, 54G, ?
questions.explanation: Numbers ×3: 2,6,18,54,162. Letters -2 backward: M(13),K(11),I(9),G(7),E(5). Combined pattern yields 162E.

questions.question: Seven people sit in a row. X is at one end. Y is at the other end. Z is in the center. W is between X and Z. V is between Z and Y. U is second to the left of V. Who is to the immediate right of W?
questions.explanation: X(1), W(2), U(3), Z(4), T(5), V(6), Y(7). Immediate right of W is U.

questions.question: Some M are N. No N are O. All P are O. Which is correct?
choices: B) Some M are not O
questions.explanation: Some M are N, and no N are O. The M's that are N cannot be O.
$3n+1$ sequence.

questions.question: A: 'B is the only daughter of my father's only sister.' What is B to A?
questions.explanation: Father's only sister = paternal aunt. Her only daughter = cousin.

questions.question: No A is B. All C are B. Some D are C. Conclusion: Some D are not A.
questions.explanation: D overlaps C, C is in B. So some D are in B. Since no B is A, those D's aren't A.

questions.question: No A is B. No B is C. Some A is C. Conclusion: Some C is not B.
questions.explanation: Some C is A. Since no A is B, those C's cannot be B. Conclusion is valid.

questions.question: 4, A, 9, B, 16, C, 25, D, ?
questions.explanation: Squares alternate with sequential letters.

questions.question: 3, G, 6, J, 9, M, 12, P, ?
questions.explanation: Numbers $+3$. Letters $+3$.

questions.question: G: 'H is the father of my brother's only sister.' What is H to G?
questions.explanation: Brother's only sister is G's sister. Her father is also G's father.

questions.question: O: 'P is the son of my son's father.' O is male. What is P to O?
questions.explanation: Son's father is O himself. His son is P.

questions.question: I: 'J is the son of my wife's sister.' I is male. What is J to I?
questions.explanation: Wife's sister's son = nephew (by marriage).

questions.question: No circle is a triangle. All triangles are polygons. Some polygons are circles. Which follows?
choices: A) Some polygons are not triangles
B) Some polygons are not circles
C) No polygon is a triangle
questions.explanation: Some polygons are circles, and no triangles are circles, so those specific polygons aren't triangles. Also, triangles are polygons that are definitely not circles.

questions.question: I: 'J is the brother of my father's mother.' What is J to I?
questions.explanation: Father's mother = grandmother. Her brother = grand-uncle.

questions.question: U: 'V is the husband of my father's mother.' What is V to U?
questions.explanation: Father's mother = grandmother. Her husband = grandfather.

questions.question: 2, A, 9, B, 28, C, 65, D, ?
questions.explanation: Alternating series. Numbers are $n^3+1$: $1^3+1=2, 2^3+1=9, 3^3+1=28, 4^3+1=65, 5^3+1=126$. Letters follow alphabetical order: A, B, C, D, E.

questions.question: O: 'P is the brother of my wife's only sister's mother.' What is P to O?
questions.explanation: Wife's sister's mother is O's mother-in-law. Her brother is O's uncle-in-law.

questions.question: A and B are married. X and Y are brothers. X is the brother of A. How is Y related to B?
questions.explanation: X and Y are brothers. Y is A's brother. Since B is married to A, Y is B's brother-in-law.

questions.question: All books have pages. Some pages have ink. No ink is colorless. Which follows?
choices: B) Some pages are not colorless
questions.explanation: Some pages have ink, and ink is not colorless. Therefore, some pages (the ones with ink) are not colorless.

questions.question: M13, K11, I9, G7, ?
questions.explanation: Descending odd-position letters and their corresponding values.

questions.question: E: 'F is the brother of my wife's father.' What is F to E?
questions.explanation: Wife's father is father-in-law. His brother is the uncle-in-law.

questions.question: Z, X, U, Q, L, ?
No square is a circle. No circle is a triangle. Conclusion: No square is a triangle.
questions.explanation: This is a fallacy of two negative premises. There is no connection made between squares and triangles; they could be separate or overlap.

questions.question: M: 'N is the sister of my father's father.' What is N to M?
questions.explanation: Grandfather's sister = Grand-aunt.

questions.question: Some people are artists. All artists have vision. No one with vision is narrow-minded. Which follows?
choices: A) Some people are not narrow-minded
questions.explanation: Some people are artists/have vision. Since those aren't narrow-minded, those people aren't narrow-minded.

questions.question: 1, B, 9, J, 25, R, ?
questions.explanation: Numbers: Squares of odd integers ($1, 3, 5, 7^2=49$). Letters: $B(2), J(10), R(18)$. Gap is constant $+8$. $18+8=26$ (Z).

questions.question: If 'A # B' means A is the daughter of B and 'A & B' means A is the husband of B, what does 'X & Y # Z' mean?
questions.explanation: Y is the daughter of Z, and X is the husband of Y. Therefore, X is the son-in-law of Z.

questions.question: All A are B. All C are B. Some C are D. Which must be true?
questions.explanation: D overlaps C, and C is a subset of B. Therefore, D must overlap B.

questions.question: M: 'N is the father of my son's mother.' What is N to M?
questions.explanation: Son's mother = M's wife. Her father = father-in-law.

questions.question: A man says, 'My grandfather's only son's only daughter's husband is my...'?
questions.explanation: 'Grandfather's only son' is the father. His 'only daughter' is the man's sister. Her husband is his brother-in-law.

questions.question: C3F6, E6H9, G9J12, I12L15, ?
questions.explanation: First letter +2: C,E,G,I,K. First number +3: 3,6,9,12,15. Second letter +3: F,H,J,L,N. Second number +3: 6,9,12,15,18.

questions.question: A, 1, D, 8, G, 27, J, 64, ?
questions.explanation: Alternating sequence. Letters: $+3$ ($A, D, G, J, M$). Numbers: Cubes ($1^3, 2^3, 3^3, 4^3, 5^3=125$). Many people choose 'L' because they accidentally count $+2$ for letters.

questions.question: U: 'V is the wife of my son's father.' What is V to U?
questions.explanation: Son's father = U. His wife = V.

questions.question: I: 'J is the son of my father's only sibling.' What is J to I?
questions.explanation: Father's sibling = uncle or aunt. Their son = cousin.

questions.question: All teachers are educators. No educator is unlettered. Some unlettered people are wise. Which follows?
choices: B) Some wise people are not teachers
D) All wise people are teachers
questions.explanation: No teacher is unlettered. Some wise people are unlettered. Therefore, those wise-unlettered people cannot be teachers.

questions.question: 2A11, 4D13, 12G17, 48J23, ?
questions.explanation: First number pattern: ×2, ×3, ×4, ×5 (48×5=240). Letters: +3 (A, D, G, J, M). Last numbers are primes starting from 11: 11, 13, 17, 23, 31.

questions.question: G: 'H is the only daughter of my paternal grandfather.' What is H to G?
questions.explanation: Paternal grandfather's daughter is G's paternal aunt.

questions.question: I: 'J is the son of my maternal grandmother's only daughter.' I is male and has no siblings. What is J to I?
questions.explanation: Mother's only son = I.

questions.question: If 'P ! Q' means P is the brother of Q; 'P # Q' means P is the wife of Q; 'P $ Q' means P is the father of Q. What does 'A # B $ C ! D' mean?
choices: A) A is the mother of D
B) A is the sister of D
C) A is the daughter of D
D) A is the aunt of D
questions.explanation: C ! D means C is the brother of D. B $ C means B is the father of C (and D). A # B means A is the wife of B. Thus, A is the mother of D.

questions.question: M: 'N is the sister of my maternal grandfather's only son.' What is N to M?
questions.explanation: Grandfather's only son is M's uncle. His sister could be M's mother or another maternal aunt.

questions.question: A is B's brother. C is A's mother. D is C's father. E is B's son. How is D related to E?
questions.explanation: B is E's parent. C is B's mother. D is C's father. D is the father of E's grandmother.
$n^2-1$ sequence.

questions.question: S: 'T is the only son of my father's only son.' S is male. What is T to S?
questions.explanation: S's son.

questions.question: 1, A, 3, C, 6, F, 10, J, ?
questions.explanation: Triangular numbers ($1, 3, 6, 10, 15$) and their letters.

questions.question: All successful people are persistent. Some persistent people are lucky. No lucky person is miserable. Which is cierto?
choices: A) All successful people are lucky
B) Some persistent people are not miserable
C) No successful person is miserable
D) Some miserable people are successful
questions.explanation: Some persistent people are lucky, and lucky people aren't miserable. Thus, some persistent people aren't miserable.

questions.question: Six people in a row. A is at an end. B is second from that end. C is third from that end. D is at the other end. E is next to D. Who is in the middle?
questions.explanation: A(1), B(2), C(3), F(4), E(5), D(6). Middle is C and F.

questions.question: Five people in a row. P is at 2. Q is at 4. R is between P and Q. S is to the left of P. Who is at 5?
O: 'P is the father of my brother's only sibling.' O is female. What is P to O?
questions.explanation: Brother's only sibling = O herself. Her father = P.

questions.question: E: 'F is the mother of my husband's daughter.' What is F to E?
questions.explanation: Husband's daughter = E's daughter. Her mother = E.

questions.question: All horses are animals. Some animals are wild. No wild thing is tamed. Which follows?
choices: B) Some animals are not tamed
questions.explanation: Some animals are wild and no wild thing is tamed. Therefore, some animals (the wild ones) are not tamed.

questions.question: Six people in a circle. P is opposite Q. R is to the right of P. S is to the left of Q. T is between P and S. Who is opposite R?
questions.explanation: Clockwise: P, R, Q, S, T, U. Opposite R is S.

questions.question: 10, J, 20, T, 30, D, 40, ?
questions.explanation: Numbers: $+10$. Letters: Position $10=J, 20=T, 30 mod{26}=4=D, 40 mod{26}=14=N$. This is a major trap where users forget the alphabet 'wraps' after 26.

questions.question: A, B, D, G, K, P, ?

questions.explanation: Cubes.

questions.question: Pointing to a man, a woman says, 'He is the son of the only sister of my father.' How is the man related to the woman?
questions.explanation: The man is the son of the woman's aunt. They are cousins.

questions.question: Z, W, S, N, H, ?
In a family, there are two married couples. A is the son of B. B is the husband of C. D is the daughter-in-law of C. How is D related to A?
questions.explanation: B and C are the parents of A. If D is C's daughter-in-law and there are only two couples, D must be the wife of A.

questions.question: All A are B. No C are B. Some D are C. Conclusion: Some D are not A.
choices: C) Only if All D are C
D) Only if All B are A
questions.explanation: Some D are C. No C are B. Thus, some D are not B. Since All A are B, if something is not B, it cannot be A. Hence, some D are not A.

questions.question: S: 'T is the wife of my brother's father.' What is T to S?
questions.explanation: Brother's father = S's father. His wife = S's mother.

questions.question: Some G are H. All H are I. All I are J. No J is K. Which is true?
choices: B) Some G are not K
C) Some J are not H
questions.explanation: Some G are H. Since all H are J and no J is K, no H is K. Thus, the G part that is H cannot be K.

questions.question: K: 'L is the mother of my father's mother.' What is L to K?
questions.explanation: Father's mother = grandmother. Her mother = great-grandmother.

questions.question: A is the son of B. C, B's sister, has a son D and a daughter E. F is the maternal uncle of D. What is F to A?
questions.explanation: B and C are siblings. F is the brother of C, so F is also the brother of B. A's father/mother's brother is an uncle.

questions.question: 1A2, 2C6, 3E12, 4G20, ?
questions.explanation: First number increases by 1: 1,2,3,4,5. Letter skips one: A,C,E,G,I. Last number: n×(n+1)×2: 1×2×2=2, 2×3×2=6, 3×4×2=12, 4×5×2=20, 5×6×2=30.

questions.question: Q: 'R is the brother of my wife's mother.' What is R to Q?
questions.explanation: Wife's mother = mother-in-law. Her brother = uncle-in-law.

questions.question: Six people sit in a circle facing center. P is second to the left of Q. R is opposite Q. S is to the immediate right of P. T is between R and Q. Who is to the left of U?
questions.explanation: Clockwise: Q, U, P, S, R, T. To the left of U is Q (Wait, clockwise is left for center-facing). Left of U is R.

questions.question: Z1A, X4D, V9G, T16J, ?
questions.explanation: First letter -2: Z, X, V, T, R. Number is sequence of squares: 1², 2², 3², 4², 5²=25. Last letter +3: A, D, G, J, M.

questions.question: Y: 'Z is the husband of my sister's mother's only daughter.' Y is female and has no other sisters. What is Z to Y?
questions.explanation: Sister's mother's only daughter is Y herself. Her husband is Z.

questions.question: My father's only brother's only nephew is who?
questions.explanation: Father's brother's nephew would be the children of the brother's sibling (my father).

questions.question: Eight people in a circle. A is opposite E. B is to the right of A. C is to the right of B. D is to the right of C. Who is to the right of E?
questions.explanation: Clockwise: A, B, C, D, E, F, G, H. Right of E is F.

questions.question: Z, 52, X, 48, V, 44, T, 40, ?
questions.explanation: Letters -2, Numbers are $2 	imes$ Letter position. $R=18, 18 	imes 2 = 36$.

questions.question: I: 'J is the son of my maternal aunt.' What is J to I?
questions.explanation: Aunt's son = cousin.

questions.question: A, C, F, J, O, ?
3P5, 6N10, 9L15, 12J20, ?
questions.explanation: First number +3: 3,6,9,12,15. Letter -2: P,N,L,J,H. Last number +5: 5,10,15,20,25.

questions.question: All cats are feline. Some feline are domestic. No domestic is a tiger. Conclusion: Some cats are not tigers.
choices: C) True in real life but not in logic
D) Only if all cats are domestic
questions.explanation: We know some feline are domestic (not tigers), but we don't know if those specific felines are cats. There might be no overlap between cats and domestic felines.

questions.question: Z26A1, X24C3, V22E5, T20G7, ?
questions.explanation: First letter -2: Z,X,V,T,R. First number is position. Second letter +2: A,C,E,G,I. Last number is position.

questions.question: O: 'P is the sister-in-law of my only brother.' O is female and has no other siblings. What is P to O?
choices: D) B and C are possible
questions.explanation: A brother's sister-in-law could be his sister (O) or his wife.

questions.question: B, 2, G, 7, L, 12, Q, 17, ?
questions.explanation: Constant gap of +5 for both letters and numbers. Trap: Miscounting Q to V as +4.

questions.question: Q: 'R is the wife of my brother's father.' What is R to Q?
questions.explanation: Brother's father = Q's father. His wife = Q's mother.

questions.question: If 'A + B' means A is the father of B, and 'A - B' means A is the sister of B, what does 'P - Q + R' mean?
questions.explanation: Q is the father of R, and P is the sister of Q. Therefore, P is the paternal aunt of R.

questions.question: Z, V, R, N, J, F, ?
questions.explanation: $-4$ gap backward.

questions.question: D: 'E is the wife of my son's maternal grandfather.' What is E to D?
questions.explanation: Son's maternal grandfather is D's father-in-law. His wife is D's mother-in-law.

questions.question: Some G are H. Some H are I. No I are J. All J are K. Which is true?
choices: A) Some H are not J
D) Some G are not I
questions.explanation: Some H are I, and no I is J. Therefore, those H's that are I cannot be J.

questions.question: E: 'F is the brother of my mother's only daughter.' E is female. What is F to E?
questions.explanation: Mother's only daughter is E herself. Her brother is E's brother.

questions.question: All diamonds are hard. Some hard things are minerals. No hard thing is liquid. Which follows?
choices: A) Some minerals are not liquid
questions.explanation: Some minerals are hard, and no hard thing is liquid. Thus, those minerals are not liquid.

questions.question: All roses are flowers. Some flowers fade quickly. No rose fades quickly. Which is true?
choices: A) Some flowers that fade quickly are not roses
questions.explanation: If some flowers fade quickly and no rose fades quickly, then those specific flowers cannot be roses.

questions.question: No prime number is composite. All composite numbers are positive. Some positive numbers are even. Which must be true?
choices: A) Some positive numbers are not prime
B) No prime number is positive
C) All even numbers are composite
D) No even number is prime
questions.explanation: Composite numbers are positive and composite numbers are not prime. Therefore, some positive numbers (the composites) are not prime.

questions.question: If 'P $ Q' means P is the brother of Q and 'P @ Q' means P is the wife of Q, what does 'A @ B $ C' mean?
questions.explanation: B is the brother of C, and A is the wife of B. Therefore, A is the sister-in-law of C.

questions.question: Some G are H. All H are J. Some J are not K. Conclusion: Some G are not K.
questions.explanation: The G's that are H are J's. We know some J's are not K's, but we don't know if those are the J's that are also G's.

questions.question: All roads are concrete. No concrete is soft. Some soft things are mud. Which is certain?
choices: A) Some mud is not concrete
C) No mud is a road
questions.explanation: Mud overlaps soft, and soft is not concrete, so some mud isn't concrete. Roads are concrete and concrete is not soft, so no road is soft.

questions.question: Some G are H. All G are I. No I is J. All J are K. Which is cierto?
choices: A) Some H are not J
C) Some K are not I
questions.explanation: Some H are G/I, and no I is J, so A is true. G is in I and I is not J, so B is true. J is in K and J is not I, so C is true.
Squares.

questions.question: Only pilots are cockpit-crew. Some cockpit-crew are flight-instructors. All flight-instructors are experienced. Which follows?
choices: A) Some experienced people are pilots
C) All experienced people are cockpit-crew
questions.explanation: 'Only pilots are cockpit-crew' means all cockpit-crew are pilots. Since some cockpit-crew are instructors (who are experienced), some pilots must be experienced.

questions.question: Five people sit in a circle facing the center. J is second to the right of L. K is to the immediate left of L. M is between J and K. Who is to the immediate right of N?
questions.explanation: Clockwise: L, J, N, K, M. To the right of N is J? No, clockwise is left. Right is CCW. Right of N is J.

questions.question: Only if it is Sunday do I sleep in. Today is not Sunday. Conclusion: I am not sleeping in.
choices: D) Only if I am tired
questions.explanation: 'Only if P then Q' is equivalent to 'If Q then P'. Thus, if it's not Sunday (P), then Q (sleeping in) cannot happen.

questions.question: If 'P * Q' means P is the father of Q; 'P / Q' means P is the mother of Q; 'P + Q' means P is the son of Q. What does 'A * B / C + D' mean?
choices: A) A is the father-in-law of D
B) A is the father of D
C) A is the grandfather of D
D) D is the son of A
questions.explanation: B / C means B is the mother of C. C + D means C is the son of D. Thus B and D are the parents. A * B means A is the father of B. The father of one's wife is a father-in-law.

questions.question: S: 'T is the mother of my mother's husband.' What is T to S?
questions.explanation: Mother's husband = father. His mother = paternal grandmother.

questions.question: W: 'X is the husband of my sister's mother.' What is X to W?
questions.explanation: Sister's mother = W's mother. Her husband = W's father.

questions.question: Some G are H. All H are I. All I are J. No J is K. Which is true?
choices: A) Some G are not K
B) Some J are not H
questions.explanation: Since some G are J and no J is K, A is true. Since J contains H, but J may be larger than H, B is possible (though not certain, but A and C are). Actually, in syllogism choices, 'All of the above' is often a hint. C is definitely true (H is inside J, no J is K). Since A and C are true, D is the answer.

questions.question: Six people in a row. A is at 2. B is at 5. C is to the right of B. D is between A and B. E is at the left end. Who is at position 4?
Some laws are strict. All strict rules are necessary. No necessary thing is useless. Which follows?
choices: A) Some laws are not useless
D) Some useless things are laws
questions.explanation: Some laws are strict/necessary. No necessary things are useless. Thus, those specific laws are not useless.

questions.question: M: 'N is the only sister of my father's father.' What is N to M?
questions.explanation: Father's father = grandfather. His sister = grand-aunt.

questions.question: O: 'P is the father of my mother's father.' What is P to O?
questions.explanation: Mother's father = grandfather. His father = great-grandfather.

questions.question: Pointing towards a person, a man said to a woman, 'His mother is the only daughter of your father.' How is the woman related to that person?
questions.explanation: The woman's father's only daughter is the woman herself. If she is 'his mother', she is the person's mother.

questions.question: 5Z1, 7Y3, 11X5, 17W7, ?
questions.explanation: First numbers are primes: 5,7,11,17,23. Letters decrease: Z,Y,X,W,V. Last numbers are odd sequence: 1,3,5,7,9.

questions.question: No mountain is flat. All flat things are easy to walk on. Some easy-to-walk-on things are trails. Which follows?
choices: A) No mountain is easy to walk on
B) Some things easy to walk on are not mountains
questions.explanation: Flat things are easy to walk on and flat things aren't mountains. Thus, some easy-to-walk-on things aren't mountains.

questions.question: A: 'B is the only daughter of my paternal grandfather's only son-in-law.' What is B to A?
questions.explanation: Paternal grandfather's son-in-law is A's uncle (married to A's father's sister). His daughter is A's cousin.

questions.question: B, E, I, N, T, ?
3, A, 5, C, 9, G, 17, O, ?
questions.explanation: Numbers: $2n-1$. $17 	imes 2 - 1 = 33$. Letters: Gaps double $+2, +4, +8, +16$. $15(O)+16=31 quiv 5(E)$. Trap: Forgetting the wrap-around.

questions.question: 1, A, 3, E, 7, I, 15, O, ?
questions.explanation: Numbers: $2n+1$ ($1, 3, 7, 15, 31$). Letters: Vowels ($A, E, I, O, U$). The 'silly mistake' is looking for a $+4$ letter gap instead of the vowel pattern.

questions.question: W: 'X is the sister of my father's father.' What is X to W?
questions.explanation: Father's father = grandfather. His sister = grand-aunt.

questions.question: Some books are textbooks. All textbooks are educational. No educational thing is useless. Conclusion: Some books are not useless.
choices: C) Only if all books are textbooks
D) Only if educational things are books
questions.explanation: Some books are textbooks/educational. Educational things aren't useless. Thus, those specific books aren't useless.

questions.question: S: 'T is the brother of my brother-in-law.' (Assume brother-in-law is the sister's husband). What is T to S?
questions.explanation: The brother of a sister's husband is also a brother-in-law.

questions.question: Q's mother is the sister of P and daughter of M. S is the daughter of P and sister of T. How is M related to T?
questions.explanation: M is the parent of P, and P is the parent of T. M is T's grandparent.

questions.question: Some songs are soft. No soft song is long. All long songs are epic. Which follows?
choices: A) Some epic songs are not soft
C) All soft songs are epic
questions.explanation: Some epic songs are long. No long song is soft. Thus, those epic songs aren't soft.

questions.question: 2, D, 6, H, 12, L, 20, P, ?
questions.explanation: Numbers: $+4, +6, +8, +10$. Letters: Position follows the number (mostly). $20+10=30$. $30 mod{26} = 4(D)$? No, the letters are $D(4), H(8), L(12), P(16)$. They are $+4$. $16+4=20(T)$.

questions.question: H: 'I is the son-in-law of my mother's only daughter.' H is male and has no sisters. What is I to H?
questions.explanation: If H is male and has no sisters, his mother has no 'only daughter' unless it's a step-relation not defined. In standard logic, this is a null relation.

questions.question: W: 'X is the mother of my sister's mother.' What is X to W?
questions.explanation: Sister's mother = W's mother. Her mother = W's grandmother.

questions.question: All A are B. No B is C. All C are D. Which is certain?
choices: B) Some D are not B
questions.explanation: A is in B, B is not C. So A is not C. C is in D, C is not B. So some D (the part that is C) is not B.

questions.question: Y: 'Z is the mother of my father's brother-in-law.' (Assume brother-in-law is the mother's brother). What is Z to Y?
questions.explanation: Father's brother-in-law (mother's brother) is Y's maternal uncle. His mother is Y's maternal grandmother.

questions.question: Z, W, T, Q, N, K, ?
questions.explanation: $-3$ letters.

questions.question: J: 'H is the father of my mother's brother.' What is H to J?
questions.explanation: Mother's brother's father = maternal grandfather.

questions.question: C: 'D is the wife of my father's only son.' C is female with one brother. What is D to C?
questions.explanation: Father's only son = C's brother? No, since C has one brother, that brother is father's only son. His wife = sister-in-law. Wait: but C female → father's only son = brother. His wife = sister-in-law → correct B.

questions.question: No planet is a star. All stars produce light. Some light is visible. Which must be true?
choices: B) Some things that produce light are not planets
questions.explanation: Stars produce light and stars are not planets. Thus, there are light-producing things (stars) that are not planets.

questions.question: All pens are instruments. Some instruments are musical. No musical items are silent. Which must be true?
choices: B) Some instruments are not silent
questions.explanation: Since some instruments are musical and musical items are never silent, those musical instruments are not silent.

questions.question: Some people are artists. No artist is a robot. All robots are machines. Which must be true?
choices: A) Some people are not robots
B) No machine is an artist
questions.explanation: Some people are artists. No artist is a robot. Therefore, those people who are artists are not robots.

questions.question: Some humans are immortal. No immortal is a mortal. All mortals die. Conclusion: Some humans don't die.
questions.explanation: The premises don't say *only* mortals die. It's possible for immortals to die in ways other than mortality-related causes (though the word 'immortal' suggests otherwise, strictly logical syllogisms follow the terms provided).

questions.question: G: 'H is the husband of my daughter's only paternal aunt.' What is H to G?
questions.explanation: Daughter's paternal aunt is G's sister. Her husband is G's brother-in-law.

questions.question: U: 'V is the father of my son's mother.' What is V to U?
questions.explanation: Son's mother = U's wife. Her father = father-in-law.
